* Erfarenhet av att ha tagit helhetsansvar för ett projekt i en organisation. Till exempel samarbete med IT-resurser och leverantörer av data, samt kravinhämtning från berörda användare.
* Talar, läser och skriver väl på svenska och engelska


**Meriterande krav**
 Dessa kunskaper/erfarenheter som är en fördel att ha, men inte avgörande eller krav för att bli kallad på intervju eller för att få tjänsten. Nedanstående är färdigheter som du kommer att utvecklas inom hos oss.
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att ansvara för driften av AI-lösningar i produktion. Inklusive loggning, monitorering, felhantering, och löpande förbättringar.
* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet kopplat till kraftsystem eller elmarknad inom näringsliv, myndighet, eller universitet/högskola.
* Erfarenhet av matematisk programmering och optimering. Till exempel CPLEX, Gurobi, eller GAMS.
* Kännedom om energisystemets marknadslösningar. Till exempel spotmarknaden, stödtjänstmarknaderna, eller flexibilitetsmarknaderna.
* Erfarenhet av ett tillämpat AI- eller maskininlärningsprojekt inriktat på kraftsystem eller elmarknad.


 Bra att veta
   

  

* Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm/Sundbyberg
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Resor inom Norden och Europa kan förekomma, men begränsad omfattning, max några gånger per år
* Sista ansökningsdag 2025-01-07, vi tar inte emot personligt brev i samband med din ansökan
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning


 Kontakta gärna rekryterande chef Pontus Wallin, tel. nr. 010-475 81 14, alternativt ansvarig rekryterare AnnSophie Brezén, tel. nr. 010-475 80 07. Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Mikael Hedenheim ST, 010 475 84 68. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
   

  

 För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Total Rewards SME - Job Architecture
description:
**Job Description**
 We are on a journey to create the best people organization in the industry. We created a new People Life Cycle team as a part of our Central People Organization with the objective to deliver the most impactful, holistic and customer centric colleague journey. People Life Cycle is home for a diverse group of HR Subject Matter Experts, who work together towards our common people strategy and vision.
   

  

 Total Rewards is part of People Life Cycle and consists of teams focusing on Core Compensation, Pension & Benefits, Executive Compensation and Global Mobility. As a Total Rewards SME – Job Architecture, you will be part of the Core Compensation team and will report to the rewards function head, Manager of Reward. As an SME for the area, you will be owning the H&M Group Job Architecture Framework, further developing, implementing, and maintaining the job catalogue, ensuring through strong governance alignment with the business goals, industry standards and the connected people life cycle processes.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Job Architecture Ownership: Further develop, implement, and maintain the organization's job architecture framework.
* Governance: Establish and enforce a governance process for job architecture, including job evaluation, levelling, and titling standards.
* Job Catalogue Management: Secure periodic maintenance and updates of the existing job catalogue, ensuring accurate and up-to-date catalogue structure and classifications.
* Job Architecture Integration: Enable the core framework integration and utilization by other people processes. Collaborate cross-specialist areas to enable a coherent and meaningful colleague journey based on the job architecture foundations.
* Calibration Reviews: Facilitate functional and cross-functional calibrations to ensure consistency and fairness in job evaluations across the organization.
* Organizational Design: Participate in major reorg projects by consulting the business on org sizing and levelling. Assess and maintain Mercer based organizational sizing.
* HR and Rewards Partnership: Partner with HR business partners, Rewards Managers and other stakeholders, provide guidance and support on job architecture-related matters.
* Data Analysis and Reporting: Analyse job architecture data to identify trends, gaps, and opportunities for improvement. Perform periodic job framework data quality reviews and initiate data clean-up. Update Dashboards.
* Pay Transparency: Actively contribute to the Group Pay Transparency Strategy and Implementation, though proper job catalogue utilization and analysis.
* Continuous Improvement: Lead initiatives to continuously improve job architecture processes and tools, incorporating feedback from stakeholders and staying abreast of industry best practices.
* Training and Communication: Develop and deliver training programs and communication materials to educate HR, Total Rewards, Colleagues and Leaders on job architecture principles and practices.
* Strategic Planning: Contribute to the strategic planning of the Total Rewards function, aligning job architecture initiatives with broader People Life Cycle goals.
* Mercer IPE Methodology: Utilize the Mercer International Position Evaluation (IPE) methodology to evaluate jobs, ensuring a consistent and equitable approach to job evaluation across the organization. Maintain the IPE and internal position levels correlation tables.
* Executive Level Evaluation: Conduct evaluations for executive-level positions, ensuring consistency and sustainable org design. Own the levels and structure for CEO direct reports and grandchildren layer.
* External Benchmark: Organize and run the annual survey submission process. Create and govern a job matching database.
* Vendor Management: Maintain contacts with global vendors and service providers in the area of job architecture and market benchmarks.


**Qualifications**
* Several years of experience in human resources and rewards, with a focus on job architecture, job evaluation, and compensation.
* Business education degree
* Proficient understanding of Mercer job architecture, job analysis, and International Position Evaluation (IPE) methodology.
* Strong analytical skills to interpret job descriptions and lead job evaluation interviews.
* Strong technical skills mainly with Excel and PPT, to be able to manage large databases and prepare presentations.
* Strong organizational agility and ability to understand organizational design, dependencies and business models.
* Stakeholder management and ability to respectfully challenge senior stakeholders during evaluation interviews and calibration meetings.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Strong problem-solving skills to address job architecture-related challenges.
* Project management skills and ability to lead initiatives and influence stakeholders across the organization.


**Additional Information**
**About the recruitment process**
 This is a full-time permanent role, based at the head-office in Stockholm and you will report to Bilyana Lazarevic, Manager of Reward.
   

  

 If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your CV in English. We would like to receive your application at the latest by
 **16 December** 
 . Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

**Company Description**
 H&M Group is a global family of brands and businesses. We make it possible for customers around the world to express themselves through fashion and design in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M Group here.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Assistant Designer Hardware
description:
Are you passionate about design, detail-oriented, and inspired by the great outdoors? This could be your chance to get to work with a team that shares the same passion. We are now looking for a
 **Assistant Designer Hardware** 
 at Fjällräven for a 1-year contract starting in the beginning of 2025.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Assistant Designer Hardware you will be a part of the R&D Team. You will be responsible for assisting the designers in the hardware and equipment segment within the R&D department. You should be proactive and creative, and able to work independently as well as part of the team.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Maintain updated Seasonal Design Sketches.
* Creation and maintaining of Seasonal Collection Boards.
* Attend Product Design Meetings supporting designers with action plans.
* Attend proto meetings and assist designers with follow up changes where needed.
* Support Designers with presentation material for in-house presentations.
* Assist with current product design changes were necessary to address in-line production issues.
* Organize Seasonal Colour meetings and action plans.
* Update Colour Palette in Adobe Illustrator and PLM system.
* Coordinate Lab-Dip process each season and administer lab-dip requests.
* General administration and input of information on the PLM system.


 This is a full-time position based at our office in Solna. You will report directly to the Head of Research & Design Hardware.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We think you would be a great match for the position if:
   

  

* You have a degree in Design (Product, Accessories, Industrial, Graphics, Fashion design).
* You have experience of working in the textile industry.
* You are an excellent team player with the ability to take direction, remain highly flexible and adaptable when faced with ambiguity.
* You are structured and have an eye for details.
* You are proficient in using Adobe Illustrator, Adobe In-Design, and Photoshop (experience in 3D), Keynote/ Powerpoint, Word, Excel, and Outlook.
* You are an active outdoor user with experience and knowledge in a wide range of outdoor activities.
* A keen interest in colour and materials.


 To succeed and thrive in this position your communication skills both verbally and visually need to be strong, and you need to feel comfortable communicating in English, both written and spoken.
   

  

 Here you get to work with a competent and skilled team, where the passion for the outdoors and our brand is seen in every piece of our work. We want you to feel and have the same passion and engagement we have when it comes to developing designs that embrace the company’s statement to be the most premium and sustainable global Outdoor Brand.
   

  

**About Us**
 When you join Fjällräven, you join a 60-year-old legacy of commitment to a common goal: to make nature more accessible to more people. We develop timeless, quality outdoor gear; we act responsibly toward nature, animals, & people; and we inspire passion for outdoor life. If you were waiting for an opportunity to make an impact, this is it!
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Working for Fjällräven means being part of an international fast-growing company that wants to inspire people to walk with nature. As an employee for Fjällräven you are offered:
   

  

* Opportunity to learn more about the outdoors, for instance, Fjällräven Classic and/or Winter education.
* Access to our spectacular satellite office located in a barn in Norra Djurgårdsstaden.
* An international work environment where initiatives are cherished.
* Marvelous colleagues who share a passion for the outdoors and sustainability.
* Benefits according to the collective bargaining agreement between Unionen and IKEM.

title: PKI-specialist
description:
Svenska kraftnät är en av de viktigaste aktörerna för en hållbar energiomställning. Som PKI-specialist erbjuds du ett av Sveriges viktigaste IT-jobb, i vilket du varje dag kommer att bidra till Sveriges elförsörjning. Vi behöver dig för att lyckas med vårt samhällsviktiga uppdrag att elektrifiera Sverige.
   

  

 Vi är i dag ca 500 personer på IT och vi kommer att växa ytterligare de kommande åren. Detta för att kunna skapa förutsättningar för Sverige att kunna fördubbla sin elproduktion och nå klimatmålen genom att helt ställa om till fossilfri energi. För att lyckas kommer vi att använda oss av den senaste tekniken för att öka kapaciteten i vår infrastruktur och samtidigt öka utvecklingstakten kring system, digitalisering och processer.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Svenska kraftnät befinner sig i en expansiv och kritisk fas, där vi bygger upp en helt ny infrastruktur. Som PKI-specialist får du möjligheten att vara med och att forma hela PKI-området – från grunden. Du kommer att utveckla lösningar med hög säkerhetsnivå och medvetenhet, där ditt arbete gör skillnad för hela Sveriges energiframtid.
   

  

 Du kommer till ett erfaret och engagerat team och kommer få arbeta i en stor och mycket komplex IT-miljö, med egen kontroll över drift och utveckling av alla lager av infrastrukturen. Du kommer spela en nyckelroll i att säkra elförsörjningen och stärka motståndet mot angrepp.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Sätta struktur och övergripande design för PKI-området – från grunden (!)
* Kravställning, utveckling och förvaltning av de nya PKI-lösningarna
* Installation, konfiguration och dokumentation av HSM
* Utveckla, underhålla och administrera digital certifikathantering
* Ta fram policydokument kopplade till PKI och processbeskrivningar för dess hantering
* Bidra i utvecklingsarbetet mot virtualiserade och automatiserade tjänster


**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som är självgående och har en god förmåga att ta egna initiativ. Du bör kunna ta dig an ett övergripande perspektiv och det är viktigt att du hela tiden ser till helheten. Vidare ser vi att du har god förmåga att bygga relationer och kommunicera med olika intressenter på alla nivåer för att framgångsrikt styra arbetet, visualisera målbilden och få med dig andra framåt.
   

  

**Skallkrav**
* Flerårig erfarenhet av installation och administration av PKI-system
* Erfarenhet av att sätta struktur för uppbyggnad av PKI
* Relevant utbildning inom IT eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt som vi bedömer är likvärdig
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och i skrift


**Meriterande Erfarenhet**
* Hardware Security Module (HSM)
* Lösningsarkitektur och design av PKI-lösningar
* PKI-system i Linuxmiljöer
* KMIP
* Utveckla, underhålla och administrera digital certifikathantering
* Processutveckling för hantering av digitala certifikats livscykel
* Arkitektur och implementation av infrastruktur för säker kryptonyckelförvaring/hantering
* Även certifieringar inom IT-säkerhet eller IT-arkitektur är meriterande


**Bra att veta**
* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg (Stockholm)
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-01-23. Vi tar inte emot personligt brev i samband med din ansökan.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med ev. beredskap


 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Svenska kraftnät med IDG Recruitment.
   

  

 Vid frågor, kontakta rekryteringskonsult Alexandra Tihinen,
 **alexandra.tihinen@foundryco.com** 
 , 070-447 92 24, alternativt Maria Sahlén rekryterare hos Svenska kraftnät,
 **maria.sahlen2@svk.se** 
 , 010-489 20 27.
   

  

 Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Mikael Hedenheim, ST, tel. 010-475 84 68. Du når oss också via e-post:
 **fornamn.efternamn@svk.se** 
 .
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
   

  

 För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Infrastructure - Platform DevOps Engineer
description:
Are you an ambitious DevOps Engineer eager to jump in a world of complex challenges to modernise web and globally distributed applications? We are hiring!
   

  

 Product Development at Betsson Group
   

  

 Our Product Development organisation is truly Global with cross functional teams spanning 6 Tech Hubs – Malta, Budapest, Stockholm, Tallinn, Kyiv and Athens. With nearly 600 strong professionals, the Product Development organisation is spear-headed by our CTO-CPO with all our talented Area Teams working together.
   

  

 A taster of what you will be involved with
   

  

* Working with cutting edge technology enabling our Cloud Journey
* The Platform Core team is responsible for managing Infrastructure as Code for parts of our Core Platform Layer (Kubernetes Clusters, Message Broker backends, Infrastructure tooling), providing a distributed runtime platform that ensures optimal performance of our business applications, APIs and websites
* Building our Infrastructure Platforms as self-service to our developers and providing guidance and tooling for developers to self-manage their applications cross environments
* Continuously improve and develop our platforms based on business needs. Analyse, diagnose and solve issues of efficiency performance and scale collaborating cross functional with colleagues from different teams


 Right now, we are looking to strengthen further the management of our Kafka Messaging Platform and looking for a DevOps engineer with strong knowledge and experience in managing Kafka infrastructure.
   

  

 You're good at
   

  

* Strong knowledge and experience in setting up and administering Kubernetes clusters, preferably with experience with AWS EKS and Rancher RKE.
* Strong knowledge and experience of managing Kafka infrastructure in a geo-distributed setup, administration, and configuration of such service.
* Managing Cloud Infrastructure via Infrastructure as Code using Terraform, with a good understanding of terraform modules and workflows.
* Experience working with cloud providers, with AWS as preference, and strong knowledge with Cloud provider services such as EC2, ALBs, VPC, and EKS
* Experience in building scalable and distributed infrastructure
* Experience in using versioned source control to manage code changes
* Familiarity with the open-source monitoring stack of Prometheus/Grafana.
* Ability to write scripts in Python, Bash, Powershell or similar
* Experience in using and managing Linux distributions
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex technical issues and provide effective solutions in a timely manner.
* Knowledge of best practices in IT operations, such as ITIL (IT Infrastructure Library) and DevOps principles.
* Ability to adapt to changing technologies and work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* Required to be on an On-call support schedule.


 Who We Are
   

  

 Betsson Group is one of the largest companies within the Global iGaming space and can trace our heritage as far back as the 1960’s. We’re Swedish and publicly listed too with our Operational HQ located on the Mediterranean Island of Malta.
   

  

 We strive to deliver the best customer experience in the industry. As a market leader within iGaming we offer online gaming products across 12+ jurisdictions and 20+ brands.
   

  

 You will be part of a passionate team, which is building an industry leading, scalable, multi-brand platform used by hundreds of thousands of our customers!
   

  

 What we Offer
   

  

 Much like riding a roller-coaster, sometimes life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 1900 strong, spread across 7 offices! We recognise it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you’re a go-getter, initiator and always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you’ll fit right in.
   

  

 Challenge accepted?
   

  

*****By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy*****

title: Butiksmedarbetare, team färsk, Willys Haninge Port 73
description:
*Vi är alla olika. Och det är härligt! Vi anställer inte människor efter en viss mall utan efter vem du är. För oss är driv och personlighet viktigare än erfarenhet och bakgrund. Det går bra för oss, och vi växer så det knakar. Nu söker vi fler glada medarbetare med rätt inställning och vilja att utvecklas!*
**Om jobbet**
**Tjänsten avser:** 
 Vikariat om 26 timmar
   

  

**Tillträde:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse, vikariatet förväntas pågå till och med 2025-06-08
   

  

**Arbetstider:** 
 Du kommer att variera mellan att arbeta tidig morgon, dagtid, kvällar och helger
   

  

**Krav:** 
 Gymnasial utbildning, goda kunskaper i svenska (tal och skrift). Vi välkomnar sökande i alla åldrar, men med anledning av Arbetsmiljölagen ska du ha fyllt 18 år
   

  

 Vi söker dig som vill bli en del av vårt härliga gäng på Willys Haninge Port 73! Tjänsten innebär kort och gott att du, tillsammans med dina kollegor, bidrar till att erbjuda våra kunder bra och hållbar mat till riktigt bra priser. Du är en viktig del av butiksteamet som ser till att ge våra kunder den bästa butiksupplevelsen. Här kommer lite mer om tjänsten:
   

  

* Tillsammans med dina kollegor sköter du den omväxlande dagliga driften på färskvaruavdelningen. Du kan räkna med att få många steg på stegräknaren!
* Du ser till att våra kylar och hyllor är välfyllda och ser fina ut.
* Du ser till att det är rent och snyggt i butiken.
* Du tar aktivt del i beställningar och säljplanering och bidrar till att butiken når sina försäljnings- och lönsamhetsmål.
* Du hjälper våra kunder till rätta och möter dem med kunskap, fingertoppskänsla och ett stort leende.
* Du hjälper våra kunder i kassan eller något av våra andra utcheckningsalternativ.


**Om oss**
 Det är inte alla som passar att jobba hos oss. Men många tycker att det är kul! För oss är rätt inställning och vilja att utvecklas viktigare än erfarenhet och utbildning. Hos oss får du jobba ihop med ett helt team av sköna personligheter med olika bakgrunder, kunskaper och perspektiv.
   

  

 Lite mer om oss kommer här:
   

  

* Vi är ansluta till Handelsanställdas kollektivavtal där schyssta villkor som pension, försäkringar och bra OB-ersättning ingår.
* Du får friskvårdsbidrag, personalrabatt och personalerbjudanden efter en tids anställning.
* Hållbarhet är viktigt för oss och vi arbetar till exempel alltid med att minska matsvinn i och utanför våra butiker.
* Vi ger dig bra möjligheter att växa genom olika ansvarsområden och utbildningar. Många som börjat sin resa som butiksmedarbetare på Willys är idag teamchefer, butikschefer eller har en specialistroll på vårt kontor.
* Du får erfarenheter – om t ex försäljning, service och om att driva butik – som du kommer att ha nytta av oavsett vad du väljer att göra längre fram.
* Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss här.


**Om dig**
 Du gillar mat, människor och försäljning lika mycket som vi! För oss spelar det ingen roll om du är vegan eller köttfantast, äter tacos en fredag eller en tisdag. Det fina med dig är att du är du. Och det är just det vi letar efter.
   

  

* Du vill lära dig nya saker och utvecklas.
* Du har positiv inställning och vill ha roligt på jobbet.
* Du ser när något behöver göras, kavlar upp ärmarna och får det gjort.
* Du har lätt för att samarbeta med andra – hos oss jobbar vi tillsammans som ett lag!
* Du har god IT- och datorvana, är noggrann och har inga problem att navigera i olika system.
* Det är en fördel om du har jobbat i butik eller med service, men det är inte ett krav.
* Du pratar, skriver och förstår svenska. Många av våra kunder talar fler språk än det, så om du gör detsamma är det toppen!


 Om du vill veta mer om vad tjänsten innebär, kontakta Eddie Andersson, eddie.andersson@willys.se. Vi ser gärna att du vid intresse skickar din ansökan så snart som möjligt, då tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag den 2025-01-06. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via våra jobbsidor.
   

  

*För att ta reda på om just du är den vi söker så innehåller vår rekryteringsprocess både tester och intervjuer.*
*Vi gör även bakgrundskontroll vid samtliga rekryteringar. Läs mer:* 
 Så går det till när du söker jobb inom Axfood
   

  

 Observera att vi inte under denna rekryteringsprocess kommer be dig logga in med ditt Bank-id eller scanna någon QR-kod. Vid frågor kontakta Medarbetarsupporten på jobb@axfood.se.

title: Senior Devops Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about empowering developers with smooth deployment processes? As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you’ll be at the heart of driving efficiency, reliability, and scalability for our systems. By implementing best practices and bridging the gap between development and operations, you’ll ensure seamless deployment processes and infrastructure that’s secure, scalable, and cutting-edge.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this role, you’ll enhance our platform's performance by implementing robust CI/CD pipelines and automating infrastructure provisioning. Your expertise will shape our cloud infrastructure and foster collaboration across development and operations teams, ensuring the highest level of reliability and security.
   

  

 Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Designing, building, and maintaining scalable CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps.
* Automating deployment processes using tools such as Terraform, Ansible, Bicep, or ARM templates.
* Monitoring system performance and proactively troubleshooting issues.
* Enhancing cloud infrastructure across AWS, Azure, or GCP, with a focus on Azure.
* Mentoring junior DevOps engineers and fostering a culture of excellence.
* Collaborating with engineering teams to adopt DevOps tools and practices.
* Ensuring security best practices are applied throughout the development and deployment cycle.
* Troubleshooting and resolving issues in CI/CD pipelines.


**We offer**
 In the same way that we place high demands on you, we expect you to place high demands on us. Here's what you can look forward to:
   

  

* An inclusive work environment where everyone is welcome.
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics.
* A possibility of a hybrid workplace.
* A health-promoting workplace with wellness allowances and sports activities.
* Great insurance benefits.
* Lunch benefit.
* High pension savings.


**About The Team**
 At If, culture is key, and our DevOps Center of Excellence Team embodies it every day. We’re spreading both DevOps culture and competence across our 160+ squads with a hands-on approach. Join us in shaping the future of operational excellence in the Nordics' leading insurance company.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 You are passionate about solving complex challenges, and your technical skills are complemented by your ability to work collaboratively and proactively. You thrive in environments where you can mentor others and implement best practices.
   

  

**You also have:**
* 5+ years of experience in a DevOps or similar role.
* Proficiency in CI/CD tools such as Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitLab CI, or CircleCI.
* Expertise in containerization (e.g., Docker) and orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
* Strong knowledge of scripting languages like Python, Bash, or PowerShell.
* Experience implementing infrastructure-as-code solutions.
* Familiarity with cloud architecture and services in AWS, Azure, or GCP (preferably Azure).
* Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
* Strong communication skills to collaborate effectively in a team.


**Additional Facts And The Recruitment Process**
* Application deadline: Screening and interviewing will start immediately.
* To apply: Please attach your CV.
* Work location: Stockholm.
* Start: As per agreement.
* For more information, contact Johan Wildros, Head of Devops Center of Excellence, at johan.wildros@if.se or +46 73 420 99 00


 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Background checks will be done in accordance with the law in the country of employment.
   

  

**About Us**
  

***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.**
 To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.
   

  

 We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.
   

  

 Come and join us!*

title: Automation and Validation Engineer
description:
### **Assignment Description**


* Support evolution of V&V strategy for all development phases, from lab scale to integration and deployment.
* Define requirements, architecture, interfaces, integration, verification and validation plan.
* Develop V&V test specifications enabled by virtual and of the physical domain.
* Forward looking perspective on how to virtualize and automate the physical domain e Lead system performance analysis, simulation and risk reduction activities.


**Required Skills**


* Experience in IT/OT engineering in an industrial environment. (Software Development / Automation Engineering/ Software/Hardware Verification and Validation).
* Relevant experience and expertise in Cyber Security area.
* Gathered knowledge about Software developments (RDM, SQL, etc.), Microservices distributed architectures, industrial automation, DevOps methodologies.
* University degree in Engineering (IT, Software, or Mechatronics).
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written.


**Soft Skills**


* Team player and are able to adopt to a changing environment and expectations quickly.
* Great communicator and comfortable speaking with different stakeholders and team members.
* Self-confident to lead a discussion with technical competences, you are well-structured and clear in your presentations.

title: Product Owner Members - OKQ8
description:
**Karin Arding**
Business Development Manager


"OKQ8 är ett bolag som vågar ge individen både ansvar och möjligheter, oavsett var i karriären du befinner dig, samtidigt som du får ta del av den gröna omställningen från första parkett."
**Sofia Emanuelsson**
Tidigare Trainee Sustainability & Communication


"Som trainee på OKQ8 får jag chansen att lära känna bolaget på djupet, testa olika roller och att växa både som människa och medarbetare varje dag, samtidigt som jag har otroligt kul på vägen."
**Alexander**
Supply Chain


"Det är väldigt roligt att få jobba för ett företag som ständigt är under förändring då marknaden rör sig snabbt. Här får vi möjlighet att påverka vår egen utveckling och jobba med drivna kollegor!"
Vi tror att du är en konsultativ projektledare som är van att jobba nära affären och tekniken. Som person trivs du med att nätverka och är en skicklig kommunikatör, du har även ett kundcentrerat mindset med fokus på att leverera exceptionella kundupplevelser.


Det är bra om du har tidigare erfarenhet av en produktägarroll där du har jobbat med exempelvis kunddata, medlemsklubbar och lojalitetskoncept samt har en förmåga att omsätta kommersiella koncept och affärsbehov till tekniska leveranser.


Du har även:


* Erfarenhet av att jobba i Azure DevOps eller liknande.
* God förståelse för systemintegrationer, API-tjänster, databashantering.
* Erfarenhet av att anpassa arbetet efter budget.
* Erfarenhet av att jobba enligt agila metoder och processer.
* Kompetens i SQL.
* Relevant kandidat- eller magisterexamen

Det är meriterande om du har:


* Erfarenhet av MarTech, CRM och Marketing Automation.
* Erfarenhet av att leda offshore utvecklingsteam.
* Erfarenhet från bank och finans samt förståelse för betallösningar.
* Kunskap i Power BI eller liknande BI-verktyg.

Du kommer bli del av en dynamisk arbetsmiljö med stora möjligheter att påverka och utvecklas i din karriär. På OKQ8 kommer du ta ägarskap över initiativ som kombinerar affärsutveckling och teknisk innovation i ett nära samarbete med engagerade kollegor.


OKQ8 Scandinavia arbetar för att vara en jämställd arbetsplats med medarbetare som trivs och utvecklas och där olikheter uppmuntras. Vi vill vara ett företag som speglar samhället, med en inkluderande kultur som hjälper till att minska utanförskap och bidrar till mångfald.
 

I rekryteringsprocessen ingår både psykometriska tester och kompetensbaserade intervjuer, med syfte att främja en rättvis utvärdering för alla kandidater.

title: Change & Release Manager - Sweden
description:
Epista Life Science is growing, and we are looking to add Change & Release Managers to our team!


We are a consultancy dedicated to continuously improving compliance and business in the Life Science industry. Together, Epista has over 100 employees in Denmark, Sweden, and Germany - and in Sweden, we have grown to 40 hard-working and fun-loving team members that share many years of diverse experience, backgrounds, and interests. Epista has big ambitions for the future of Life Science, and we want you to be a part of it and help us achieve those goals. If you're interested in becoming our next Change Manager, get in touch, we want to hear from you.


More and more Life Science companies are moving their business operations to the cloud and need to adapt their ERP cloud systems to better fit their rapid growth. Many of our clients need support to stay in control in this ever-changing landscape. That is where you come in.


A Change & Release Manager’s main goal is to ensure effective system changes by establishing and facilitating a process that maximizes the number of successfully implemented IT changes. Due to industry requirements for stable and high performing production in an increasingly dynamic environment, it is critical to be able to deliver frequently while carefully authorizing necessary changes.


Authorization includes risk and impact assessment, compliance and validation, budget approvals, and change documentation. Following a change authorization, IT changes need to be planned, tested, and released to operations in a stable, validated, and controlled manner. Here, the release strategy must be coordinated with relevant stakeholders and set into one shared release plan that considers goals, timelines, and resources.


In addition to managing the change and release lifecycle, the Change & Release Manager is responsible for reporting to various levels within the organization from CTO to various business units.


***Your personality is the key to success***


* Structured, dutiful, and trustworthy
* Understands the core elements of the customers’ needs

title: Data Scientist
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Role:**  

The Senior Data Scientist will play a critical role in driving the development of AI and machine learning models to enhance Predictive and Proactive Operations. The role requires a blend of technical expertise, analytical thinking, and collaborative skills to create innovative data-driven solutions that optimize incident management workflows, improve SLA adherence, and reduce MTTR. The Senior Data Scientist will work closely with cross-functional teams and contribute to building a robust and efficient operational framework.

**Key Responsibilities:**

 ***Data Science and Model Development:***

* Design and implement predictive and prescriptive models to address operational challenges.
* Develop algorithms to optimize multi-system incident workflows and improve SLA compliance.
* Collaborate with data engineers to build scalable data pipelines and ensure efficient data processing.

***Incident Management Solutions:***

* Apply advanced analytics to enhance end-to-end incident workflows across multiple systems.
* Leverage machine learning to automate detection, triage, and escalation processes.
* Monitor and fine-tune models to ensure accuracy, efficiency, and reliability.

***Collaboration and Stakeholder Engagement:***

* Partner with product teams, service delivery managers, and architects to align solutions with business goals.
* Act as a subject matter expert in data science, providing insights and recommendations to improve processes.
* Translate business requirements into actionable data science solutions.

***Continuous Improvement:***

* Analyze existing processes to identify inefficiencies and propose data-driven enhancements.
* Stay updated on industry trends, tools, and technologies to incorporate best practices into the team’s work.
* Contribute to building a library of reusable models and solutions to support the broader organization.

***Data Visualization and Reporting:***

* Develop dashboards and reports to visualize insights, track SLA adherence, and measure MTTR improvements.
* Communicate findings and progress to both technical and non-technical stakeholders effectively.

**Essential requirements:**  

* 5+ years of experience in data science, with a focus on machine learning and predictive analytics.
* Proven experience deploying machine learning models in production environments.
* Experience in incident management or operational optimization.
* Strong programming skills in Python, R, and SQL.

**•** Proficiency with machine learning frameworks like Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch. **•** Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, GCP, AWS) and MLOps tools.  

Experience with ITSM platforms (e.g., ServiceNow) and monitoring tools (e.g., Splunk, Dynatrace).  

* Hands-on experience in Predictive and Proactive Operations or similar domains.
* Knowledge of incident, event, or workflow management processes.
* Familiarity with SLA-driven operational environments.

  

**Please explain how you meet all the requirements** **when applying.**  

  

**Last day to apply**: 27-12-2024  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener! **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Agila teamledare för utveckling och förvaltning på KTH
description:
Verksamhetsstödets uppgift är att stödja universitetets utbildning och forskning. KTH:s verksamhetsstöd är inne i en spännande fas där vi tillsammans arbetar med utveckling av våra arbetsformer. Som medarbetare inom verksamhetsstödet bidrar du till KTH:s uppdrag att forska, utbilda och skapa samhällsnytta och får samtidigt möjlighet till egen professionell utveckling.  



### **Arbetsuppgifter**


Som agil teamledare på IT-avdelningen kommer du att leda uppdrag med egna utvecklingsteam och/eller leverantörer mot uppdragens mål. Du har inte ett personalansvar, men samarbetar tätt med chefer för att ge uppdragen bästa möjliga förutsättningar. I rollen arbetar du med planläggning och leverans av förvaltnings- och utvecklingsaktiviteter. Om du jobbar eller har jobbat med systemutveckling som projektledare, förvaltningsledare, scrum master eller liknande är chansen stor att du har rätt förutsättningar för tjänsten. Och har du i samma roll erfarenhet av HR, utbildning eller integration så är chansen än större.


En annan viktig del av tjänsten är att samverka med beställare, produktägare och andra intressenter för att säkerställa att uppdragens leveranser håller hög kvalitet, är ändamålsenliga och uppfyller krav, lagar och regler. Arbetsuppgifterna kan sammanfattas med följande:

* Säkerställa att webbtjänster och integrationer fungerar enligt förväntningar.
* Upprätthålla plan för uppdraget i samråd med representanter från verksamheten, arkitekter och andra intressenter.
* Säkerställa att uppdragen har de resurser och förutsättningar som är möjliga inom uppdragets plan och ramar.
* Coacha team och individer enligt agila principer och moderna förhållningssätt.
* Prioritera och fatta beslut inom ramen för uppdragets plan och ramar.
* Säkerställa att IT-tjänster lever upp till verksamhetens och IT:s krav.
* Samordna aktiviteter med leverantörer och andra utvecklingsuppdrag och projekt.

### **Vi erbjuder**

* En anställning på ett ledande tekniskt universitet som skapar kunskap och kompetens för en hållbar framtid
* Engagerade och ambitiösa kollegor samt en kreativ, internationell och dynamisk miljö


Läs mer om hur det är att arbeta på KTH.

### **Kvalifikationer**

**Krav**

* Relevant akademisk utbildning
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av att leda förvaltningsuppdrag eller projekt för utveckling av webbtjänster, integrationer, anskaffning av SaaS-tjänster eller motsvarande
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av att leda agila team
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av att bedriva coachande ledarskap, servant leadership eller motsvarande
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av behovsanalys och/eller kravanalys
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av användning och utveckling av arbetssätt kring digitala stöd för mjukvaru-utveckling som Jira, Microsoft DevOps-verktyg eller liknande
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av arbete med frågor om informationssäkerhet och IT-säkerhet
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av arbete med frågor om drift och infrastruktur, ex. CI-/CD-pipeline, i förvaltningsuppdrag eller projekt
* Kan obehindrat kommunicera och uttrycka sig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska

**Personliga egenskaper**


I rollen som agil teamledare är det viktigt att du har en helhetssyn för både uppdraget, leveransen och personerna som jobbar i uppdraget. Du har goda ledaregenskaper och har lätt för att bygga relationer med personer i och utanför uppdraget. Att ha ordning och reda på planer, arbetssätt och uppdragets förutsättningar är givetvis grunden för en motiverande kultur och en effektiv leverans.

**Meriterande**

* Högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande på minst 3 år
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av att leda förvaltningsuppdrag eller projekt i stora organisationer över 500 medarbetare
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av förvaltnings- eller utvecklingsuppdrag inom HR eller studieadministration
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av leverantörsstyrning inom IT
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av uppdrag enligt pm3
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att leda utvecklingsuppdrag eller förvaltningsuppdrag på högskola eller universitet
* Erfarenhet av att vara ledande inom införandet av agila utvecklingsmodeller som Scrum, SAFe eller liknande


Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.

### **Fackliga representanter**


Kontaktuppgifter tillfackliga representanter.

### **Ansökan**


Du ansöker via KTH:s rekryteringssystem. Du som sökande har huvudansvaret för att din ansökan är komplett när den skickas in. Ansökan ska vara KTH tillhanda senast sista ansökningsdagen vid midnatt, CET/CEST (CentralEuropean Time/Central European Summer Time).

### **Om anställningen**


Anställningen gäller tillsvidare enligt avtal.  

Anställningen inleds med sex månaders provanställning.

### **Övrigt**


Strävan efter jämställdhet, mångfald och lika villkor är både en kvalitetsfråga och en självklar del av KTH:s värdegrund


För information om behandling av personuppgifter i samband med rekrytering.


Om anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass, krävs en godkänd säkerhetsprövning i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) för att bli behörig. Information om tjänsten är placerad i säkerhetsklass ges i samband med rekryteringsprocessen.


Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av platsannonser.

  

Om KTH KTH är ett av Europas ledande tekniska universitet och en viktig arena för kunskapsutveckling. Som Sveriges största universitet för teknisk forskning och utbildning samlar vi studenter, forskare och fakultet från hela världen. Vår forskning och utbildning omfattar såväl naturvetenskap som alla grenar inom teknik samt arkitektur, industriell ekonomi, samhällsplanering, historia och filosofi. Läs mer här


Anställningsform: tillsvidare med provanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 2 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: VP-2024-0309 | Kontakt: Kristian Fäldt, Gruppchef, krifa@kth.se 070-7967808, | Publicerat: 2024-12-16 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-01-27

title: Release Manager - Sweden
description:
Epista Life Science is growing, and we are looking to add Release Managers to our team!


We are a consultancy dedicated to continuously improving compliance and business in the Life Science industry. Together, Epista has over 100 hard-working and fun-loving team members that share many years of diverse experience, backgrounds, and interests. Epista has big ambitions for the future of Life Science, and we want you to be a part of it and help us achieve those goals. If you're interested in becoming our next Release Manager, get in touch, we want to hear from you.


More and more Life Science companies are moving their business operations to the cloud and need to adapt their ERP cloud systems to better fit their rapid growth. Many of our Life Science clients need support to stay in control in this everchanging landscape.


That is where you come in. Release Management is essential for the customer’s ability to capitalize on their existing cloud environment solution. You will be the trusted advisor with regards to security vulnerability and recommendations to ensure a stable and always validated solution.


As Release Manager, you will be responsible for scheduling, planning, and controlling the quality of deployments and delivery process. This includes delivering detailed descriptions concerning the various and interconnected planning, scheduling, and building activities, as well as managing all aspects of the release process (Microsoft release governance and DevOps).


***Your personality is key to success***


* Structured, dutiful, and trustworthy
* Understands the core element of the customers’ needs
* Able to understand the value of fulfilling stakeholder requirements
* An efficient, go-to team player
* Has a thirst for knowledge and an eagerness to learn
* Eager to work in an international environment (most of our customers are international)


Most importantly you must value and treasure our long-lasting relationship with our customers – as you are the key to maintain our high customer satisfaction.


***It is an advantage if you have knowledge and experience with:***


* Azure DevOps
* Azure infrastructure
* Presentation techniques and reporting
* Release and deployment processes
* Task scheduling, time management, release and deployment planning, and prioritization
* Team management e.g., Scrum master or other Agile methodology
* ITIL methodology


You will work closely with our team of Life Science D365 experts, and we will teach you the specifics of pharma processes and validation requirements


You might be working from our office in Hørsholm/Lund/Malmø/Stockholm, the client site, at home, in a café or wherever the task requires you to be and WIFI is accessible. You could be working on:


* Release planning and coordination (major, simple, and emergency releases)
* Release build processes and procedures
* Structuring and updating release governance and overview during release progress
* Deployment management planning
* Azure DevOps
* External collaboration with customers and 3rd party suppliers
* Reporting to stakeholders and collaborating internally
* Coordinating with customers’ IT and Business responsible and other Epista consultants


At Epista, we consistently work together to unlock each consultant’s potential to continuously improve. We pioneer new ways to stay in control of patient safety and product quality and question the status quo in everything we do.


Our unique team spirit makes a positive impact – on our team, our clients, and the Life Science industry. Here, you’re never alone. We all work together for everyone’s success. And each individual is strengthened by the knowledge of the group.


We’re proud to be Epista, for good reason. If you can check some of the above marks off and if you are open to learning what you don’t already know, then please give us a call, or upload your CV and cover letter.

  


You must be eligible to work in Denmark or Sweden – and you can also be working out of one or the other country.

title: Azure Cloud Platform Engineer
description:
We make the same promise to our colleagues as we do to our customers: to always be "beside you," "behind you," and "before you." We call this "The Iver way."We are now looking for anAzure Cloud Platform Engineerto join Iver and contribute to better IT solutions that make a difference for our customers. Could you be our new colleague?
  
About Iver
  
Iver is a leading Nordic provider of cloud-based IT services with expertise in operations, cybersecurity, cloud solutions, and innovation. Our services are critical not only to our customers but also to the digitalization of society at large.
  
With headquarters in Stockholm, Iver operates primarily in the Nordics and has an agenda for continued expansion. Iver generates over 3 billion SEK in revenue and has approximately 1,500 employees working across 25 offices in the Nordics, with Intermediate Capital Group (ICG) as the majority owner.
  
Your Role at Iver
  
We are raising the bar for modern and innovative cloud platform services. This is an exciting transformation, and we need more resources to deliver on it. If you are a forward-looking Azure Engineer who thrives on cloud-native, infrastructure-as-code, and AI-driven automation, this is your chance to work with some of the best in the industry.
  
TheCloud Platform Engineerplays a key role in the Cloud Platform team, focusing on the design, implementation, and maintenance of cloud infrastructure and services on Azure. This role ensures the reliability, scalability, and security of cloud-based solutions, including compute, storage, networking, and security components. You will work as part of Iver’s Azure Engineering Team to develop our managed platform services for Azure and support customer onboarding. You will also handle Azure-related incidents at a Level 3 capacity, conduct root cause analyses, and implement solutions to prevent recurrence.
  
Example Responsibilities
  
Design, deploy, and manage scalable infrastructure on Azure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform, Bicep, and ARM.
  
Automate and optimize CI/CD pipelines for efficient software delivery using tools like GitHub Actions and Azure DevOps.
  
Implement and manage containerization with Docker and orchestration using Kubernetes or AKS.
  
Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize cloud environments for performance, scalability, and cost efficiency.
  
Collaborate with the security team to ensure best practices in cloud security, including IAM, encryption, and compliance.
  
Work closely with development teams to implement DevOps principles and ensure infrastructure aligns with application needs.
  
Stay updated on the latest cloud technologies and trends, continuously improving our infrastructure setup.
  
  

What We Offer
  
Iver – Where technology meets business. At Iver, you’ll have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and be part of an exciting growth journey. Iver has entrepreneurial roots and a culture defined by flexibility and collaboration. Our goal is to be seen as a leading partner for digital transformation by our customers in the Nordics and internationally.
  
At Iver, we are inclusive and committed to genuine collaboration, working towards common goals. There are excellent opportunities for development—whether it’s deepening your expertise, pursuing leadership roles, or exploring new areas.Being part of Iver also means being part of an ambitious and innovative company, where improving, testing, evaluating, and challenging how we do things are vital ingredients for growth.Who Are We Looking For?
  
We are looking for a driven Azure enthusiast to join our team as an advisory specialist consultant. Our mission is to provide expert advice and solutions for our customers on their technical journeys. We expect you to approach tasks with curiosity, leading both yourself and the customer toward new creative solutions and methods. A strong interest in the continuously evolving cloud technologies is essential.
  
To succeed in this role, we believe you are a skilled communicator who can simplify complex IT, understand the importance of teamwork, and possess strong business acumen.
  
Desired Qualifications
  
3-5+ years of experience or equivalent in implementation and deployment within the Microsoft Azure platform.
  
Deep knowledge of Microsoft cloud solutions, including IaaS, PaaS, and Serverless.
  
Experience with automation tools such as ARM templates, Terraform, Chef, or Ansible.
  
Proficiency with Docker and Kubernetes.
  
Development or scripting experience in C# or PowerShell.
  
Knowledge and experience in network topologies and firewalls.
  
Expertise in security practices for infrastructure, applications, IAM, or platforms.
  
Strong familiarity with Microsoft tools and platforms, such as Azure, Office 365, Power BI, Active Directory, Intune, etc.
  
  

Location
  
Iver has 25 offices across Sweden and Norway. For this role, you will be based at one of our offices in Stockholm, Oslo, Malmö or Gothenburg.
  
Apply Now!
  
Selection is ongoing, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Iver strives for gender balance and values ethnic and cultural diversity. Desired start date: as soon as possible or per agreement.
  
You are welcome to contact Olav Nguyenat olav.nguyen@iver.no with any questions regarding the role. We look forward to your application!Welcome to Iver!
  
We look forward to your application!
  
Welcome to Iver!

description:

As part of an ambitious and innovative company, improving, testing, evaluating, and rethinking how we operate are essential parts of our growth strategy.

We’re looking for an AWS enthusiast eager to work as an advisory specialist consultant. You write code or configuration for infrastructure-related components instead of long scripts or manual operations. You think like a software developer but create cloud-native infrastructure.
  
Our mission is to provide expert advice and solutions for our customers' technical journeys. You’ll be expected to lead both yourself and our customers toward innovative solutions and methods with curiosity and creativity. A passion for the ever-evolving cloud technology landscape is key.
  
To thrive in this role, you should be an excellent communicator, able to simplify complex IT concepts, and understand the importance of teamwork to achieve goals. Strong business acumen is also essential.
  
  

**What We’re Looking For:**  

3-5+ years of experience or equivalent in AWS platform implementation and deployment.
  
Deep knowledge of AWS cloud solutions such as IaaS, PaaS, and Serverless.
  
Experience with automation tools like Terraform, CloudFormation, Chef, or Ansible.
  
Proficiency with Docker and Kubernetes.
  
Knowledge and experience in network topologies and firewalls.
  
Expertise in security practices for infrastructure, applications, IAM, or platforms.
  
Strong knowledge of Microsoft tools and platforms such as AWS, Office 365, Power BI, Active Directory, Intune, etc.
  
  

**Bonus skills:**  

Microsoft Certified AWS Solutions Architect Expert or Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert: Cloud Platform and Infrastructure.
  
AWS Security Engineer Associate certification.
  
  

Location
  
Iver operates in 25 locations across Sweden and Norway. For this role, we expect you to work from one of our offices in Stockholm, Oslo, Malmö or Gothenburg.
  
Apply Today!
  
Selection is ongoing, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Iver strives for gender balance and values ethnic and cultural diversity.
  
Desired start date is as soon as possible or as agreed.
  
You are welcome to contact Mattias Persson at mattias.persson@iver.se with any questions regarding the role. We look forward to your application!Welcome to Iver!

title: Cloud Advisory
description:
We make the same promise to our colleagues as we do to our customers: to always be "beside you," "behind you," and "before you." We call this "The Iver Way." Now, we are looking for a Cloud Advisor to join our team at Iver and contribute to better IT solutions that make a real difference for our customers. Are you our new colleague?
  
About Iver
  
Iver is a leading Nordic full-service provider of cloud-based IT services with expertise in operations, cybersecurity, cloud, and innovation. Our services are critical not only for our customers but also for the digitalization of society at large. With its headquarters in Stockholm, Iver primarily operates in the Nordics with an agenda to continue expanding. Iver has an annual revenue of over SEK 3 billion and approximately 1,500 employees working across our 25 offices in the Nordic region.
  
Your Role at Iver
  
We help our customers create a vision and roadmap for a modern and secure IT environment, integrating areas such as cloud, security, and data to develop and manage services that enable innovation and efficiency. We are now seeking more Cloud Advisors who understand technology, processes, and organizations—and how these can be applied to deliver measurable business value.
  
As a Cloud Advisor, you will be part of our cloud team, working with clients across all customer and industry verticals. You will lead customer dialogues, developing plans for implementing and evolving cloud services. You are a T-shaped professional, capable of engaging in broad discussions based on your extensive cloud experience while diving into deep technical conversations when necessary.
  
Example Responsibilities
  
Advising customers on adopting cloud technologies.
  
Developing strategies and roadmaps for customers' transitions to Iver's cloud solutions.
  
Leveraging experience with infrastructure and platform services on Azure/AWS.
  
Leading analyses and evaluations of customers' existing IT environments.
  
Preparing presentations and briefings for communication with senior executives.
  
Driving internal service development, including creating new services and improving existing ones.
  
Identifying and implementing cost optimization strategies for cloud services.
  
Ensuring cloud solutions meet security and compliance requirements.
  
Educating and mentoring customer teams on cloud best practices.
  
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver integrated solutions.
  
  

What We Offer You
  
Iver – Where technology meets business. At Iver, you’ll have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and be part of an exciting growth journey. Iver has entrepreneurial roots and a culture defined by flexibility and collaboration. Our goal is to be seen as a leading partner for digital transformation by our customers in the Nordics and internationally. At Iver, we are inclusive and committed to genuine collaboration, working towards common goals. There are excellent opportunities for development—whether it’s deepening your expertise, pursuing leadership roles, or exploring new areas. Being part of Iver also means being part of an ambitious and innovative company, where improving, testing, evaluating, and challenging how we do things are vital ingredients for growth.
  
Who Are We Looking For?
  
We are looking for a Cloud Advisor who can combine strategic consulting and technical expertise to help our customers maximize the benefits of cloud technologies. In this role, you will be a key player guiding our customers in identifying and implementing cloud solutions that drive real business value for their organizations. You have proven experience in designing and implementing cloud technologies within companies, either as a consultant or in a permanent role. You are accustomed to working with senior leaders (up to C-level), setting visions, and leading transformations toward the cloud. We believe you are a strong communicator, skilled at simplifying complex IT concepts, and understand the importance of teamwork in achieving goals.
  
We Think You Have
  
Ability to create and align cloud strategies with organizational business goals and digital transformation objectives
  
Proficiency in building Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) and Return on Investment (ROI) analyses for cloud adoption
  
Ability to design high-level cloud architectures, hybrid solutions, and multi-cloud strategies
  
Experience with rehosting, replatforming, refactoring, and rebuilding strategies for modernization
  
In-depth knowledge of major cloud providers (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their service offerings
  
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to interact effectively with both management and technical teams
  
Familiarity with frameworks like Microsoft’s Cloud Adoption Framework or AWS Well-Architected Framework
  
Understanding of agile methodologies and how DevOps practices integrate with cloud strategies
  
A problem-solving mindset with the ability to navigate complex project environments.
  
  

Bonus Skills
  
Relevant certifications; Azure Solutions Architect Expert or AWS Certified Solutions Architect (Professional) or similar
  
  

Location
  
Iver operates in 25 locations across Sweden and Norway. For this role, we expect you to work from one of our offices in Stockholm, Oslo, Malmö or Gothenburg.
  
Apply Today!
  
Selection is ongoing, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Iver strives for gender balance and values ethnic and cultural diversity.
  
Desired start date is as soon as possible or as agreed.
  
You are welcome to contact Mattias Persson at mattias.persson@iver.se with any questions regarding the role. We look forward to your application! Welcome to Iver!

title: Senior testare
description:
Vi söker senior testare för konsultuppdrag
  
Skånetrafiken bedriver ett IT-program vid namn Pandora. Resultatet av projektet ska leda till ett nytt systemstöd för Affärsområde Serviceresor. Flera moment som idag görs manuellt kommer nu istället att utföras med hjälp av det nya systemstödet. Detta gäller ett stort antal funktioner för medarbetare inom förvaltningen, för användare inom vården hos både region och kommun, men även hos kunder och de företag som kör färdtjänst och sjukresa. Programmet går mot utrullning under 2024 och det finns en stark organisation för kravhantering och utveckling.
  
På den här resan letar vi just nu efter en senior testare för att gå med i vårt team av roliga, samarbetsvilliga och skickliga kollegor.
  
  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**  

Skriva, exekvera och rapportera manuella tester.
  
Skriva och underhålla automatiska tester i Cypress.
  
Starta upp automatiska tester för nya system tillsammans med andra testare.
  
Föreslå och driva tekniska lösningar och förbättringar inom autotestområdet.
  
  

**Önskad kompetens:**  

Självgående och flexibel testare med förmåga att utföra både manuella och automatiserade tester.
  
Erfarenhet av testautomatisering med verktygen cypress, playwright, appium eller liknande.
  
**Erfarenhet av att testa mot API:** er.
  
Erfarenhet av att integrera tester i CI/CD-pipelines.
  
Erfarenhet av Azure DevOps.

title: AI-Tech Lead sökes till flera orter!
description:
Som Tech Lead hos Knowit får du möjligheten att arbeta med innovativa projekt inom både privata och offentliga organisationer. Du kommer att spela en viktig roll i att hjälpa våra kunder utveckla AI-baserade system och lösningar, samt bidra till att stärka vår organisations kompetens inom det växande AI-området. Du kommer att bli en viktig del av vårt befintliga AI-nätverk, där engagerade kollegor med passion för området samverkar. Tillsammans skapar vi en utvecklingsplan som matchar dina intressen och mål för din fortsatta karriärutveckling.


**Vem är du?**

Vi söker dig som har tidigare arbetat som Teknisk Projektledare, IT-Arkitekt eller likande roller. Du har praktisk erfarenhet och stort intresse av AI-utveckling samt erfarenhet av att implementera lösningar som bygger på olika generativa AI-funktioner.


Du har varit rådgivande till beslut som påverkar IT-arkitektur. Du har utmärkta kommunikationsförmågor, och kan på ett inspirerat sätt översätta komplexa AI-koncept till tydliga affärsstrategier för olika intressenter. Du drivs av att omvandla kundens krav och behov till hållbara lösningar.


Du har arbetserfarenhet inom **några** av dessa områden:

* Python
* LLM, Large Language Models
* Docker
* REST
* DevOps
* Generativa AI verktyg


Meriterande:


* AWS
* Azure AI
* Microsoft Azure
* SQL
* CI/CD


Som person är du positiv, nyfiken på ny teknik, och trivs med att samarbeta i ett team av likasinnade.


Det är ett krav att du har relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning, alternativt yrkeshögskola kombinerat med praktisk erfarenhet.


Du behärskar svenska i både tal och skrift.

**Vi erbjuder**


Hos Knowit får du en trygg och utvecklande arbetsplats där dina kollegor stöttar och inspirerar dig. Du har möjlighet att arbeta med välkända kunder i alla branscher, både inom privat och offentlig sektor. Vi värdesätter jämställdhet och mångfald, och arbetar aktivt för att främja detta i vår rekrytering och i ledarskapet.


Utöver förmåner och attraktiva villkor, vittnar våra medarbetare om att den bästa delen med att arbeta på Knowit är kollegorna och företagskulturen. Vi ordnar aktiviteter både inom friskvård och olika sociala evenemang för våra medarbetare.


Just nu satsat vi på att bli flera experter inom AI-området och vill därför hitta nya medarbetare på flera orter


Låter detta som en spännande möjlighet för dig? Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan idag och bli en del av vårt engagerade team på Knowit!


Har du frågor om Knowit eller rollen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Olise Östmark, ansvarig rekryterare: Olise.ostmark@knowit.se


– vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Storage Infra & HW Architect
description:
**Grow with us**
----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

Ericsson SAN Lab Operations have a strategy to transform the infrastructure service delivery in global standardized ICT environments based on software defined automated services with the aim to enable consumption of services through either a portal or application programming interface (API). This would enable further automation in the consumers’ organizations, mainly the different R&D units within Ericsson.

 **What you will do:**

  

* Active contribution in the design and development of automation of network and network security services, from pre-study to in-production in a corporate data center environment.
* Active contribution to all phases of software development, from the architecture design phase until the automated service in deployed in production.
* Active contribution to the actual software implementation phase, starting with outcome of service architecture design, software architecture design to service being release in production.
* Contribute to the evolution of the development ecosystem (development environment, development support tools…).
* Active contribution to the long-term sustainability of the automation software, end-to-end architectural software consistency and integration assignments, together with other experienced architects.
* Apply requirements engineering’s best practices during system design and aligning to Ericsson’s requirements engineering processes.

 **The skills you bring:**

  

* Strong experience working in DevOps setup.
* Strong understanding of development practices (Python; REST API's and JSON; Perl; Ansible, YAML, GIT/Gerrit…).Other programming & scripting languages (ex.: Perl, Ansible, TypeScript, Jenkins, PHP, MySQL...).
* Strong experience with design of CI/CD setups and related tools.
* Experience designing testing & verifications setups, as well as related tools.
* Experience with containerized service deployment.
* Experience in lean and agile ways of working and its implementation in large organizations.
* Experience in network services and/or operations is a major plus.
* Excellent competence in secure architectural system and service design.
* Experience interacting with stakeholders in an international environment.
**Last date to apply : 30th December 2024**

 **Why join Ericsson?**

  

At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**

  

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
