We support them with our strong advisory and make their digital transformation possible. At Epista, the application architect’s main focus will be to offer advice about the chosen solution, the business, and compliance.


As an ERP advisor, you are the trusted person that can combine the possibilities and opportunities of the solutions to fit customers’ business needs. Epista’s ERP team consists of ERP system experts that help our customers select solutions and partners, support them in implementing the systems, and build an operational structure that is efficient, in control, and in compliance, thereby giving the customers full return on their investment.


Depending on your expertise and interest, you may:

title: Teknisk skribent
description:
Ansök nu


Etteplan är ett ledande ingenjörsföretag som formar framtidens industrier. Vi är över 4000 teknikspecialister som brinner för teknik och människor. Tillsammans formar vi framtidens innovationer och utveckling inom en global affärsmiljö.


Kompetensutveckling och spännande uppdrag i all ära men på Etteplan är gemenskap och kollegial samhörighet lika viktigt! Här är det högt i tak och du får vara som du är. Olikheter är något vi omfamnar då vi vet att det berikar och bidrar till nya perspektiv. Vi har fokus på att bibehålla en familjär känsla på våra kontor och alla är viktiga för att bygga teamet tillsammans – vi kallar det för Smarter Toghether!



Din roll  

I rollen som teknisk skribent kommer du att arbeta nära våra kunder. Dessa finns inom flera olika branscher och många är också branschledande inom sina respektive områden. Vi arbetar i både nationella och internationella projekt där vi leder och fördelar arbetet, men även på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Placeringsorten kommer att vara Jönköping och teamet består av teknikinformatörer med olika kompetenser – skribenter, illustratörer, metodtekniker, projektledare och kombinationer av dessa. Vi arbetar ofta över kontorsgränserna och tillämpar hybridarbete, vilket kan ge möjlighet att arbeta viss tid från annan plats än kontoret.


Som teknisk skribent är din huvudsakliga arbetsuppgift att skapa och utveckla olika typer av teknisk dokumentation åt någon eller några av våra kunder. Du kommer att erbjudas möjlighet att arbeta både under eget ansvar i mindre projekt men även som en del av större projekt. Du kommer att ha kontakt med kund för informationsöverföring och ansvarar sedan för processen från start till klart – självständigt eller i en arbetsgrupp.



Vårt recept på framgång är teamwork, utveckling och en stor dos ”kul på jobbet”. Tillsammans jobbar vi också för att ge våra kunder de allra bästa lösningarna.



Din profil  

Vi söker dig som redan är och vill fortsätta utvecklas som teknisk skribent alternativt har en annan lämplig bakgrund och ett intresse för teknik och skrivande. Som konsult får du möjlighet till uppdrag hos olika kunder och därför är dina personliga egenskaper viktiga. Du är en social person som nyfiket tar dig an utmaningar samtidigt som du är lösningsorienterad och metodisk. Du gillar samarbete men är också självgående och tar ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter. Vidare är du kommunikativ och uttrycker dig obehindrat på både svenska och engelska för en effektiv dialog med kunder och medarbetare.



För att kunna möta våra kunders behov behöver du dessutom:


* Kunna skriva och ha känsla för text och struktur
* Ha en passande eftergymnasial utbildning, som ger dig en bra grund som teknisk skribent
* Kunna förstå nya produkter och sätta dig in i användarens informationsbehov vid det givna tillfället
* Vilja ta ansvar för dina uppdrag



Meriterande är också vana vid att jobba i något XML-baserat CMS, kunna skriva topic-baserat samt att du är bekväm att arbeta med verktygen inom Adobe Creative Cloud och Microsoft 365. Har du dessutom kunskap inom CAD, STE (Simplified Technical English), DITA och/eller S1000D är det ett extra plus!



Känner du att Etteplan är rätt för dig? Skicka in din ansökan idag och bli en del av vårt team!



Årsskiftet brukar vara en överlastad period när vi har många annonser publicerade över ledigheten och därmed även har många sökande, därför kan det ta längre tid för oss att återkoppla till dig om din status i din rekryteringsprocess. Vi tackar dig för din förståelse och ditt tålamod!

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Role:**  

The Senior Data Scientist will play a critical role in driving the development of AI and machine learning models to enhance Predictive and Proactive Operations. The role requires a blend of technical expertise, analytical thinking, and collaborative skills to create innovative data-driven solutions that optimize incident management workflows, improve SLA adherence, and reduce MTTR. The Senior Data Scientist will work closely with cross-functional teams and contribute to building a robust and efficient operational framework.

**Key Responsibilities:**

 ***Data Science and Model Development:***

* Design and implement predictive and prescriptive models to address operational challenges.
* Develop algorithms to optimize multi-system incident workflows and improve SLA compliance.
* Collaborate with data engineers to build scalable data pipelines and ensure efficient data processing.

***Incident Management Solutions:***

* Apply advanced analytics to enhance end-to-end incident workflows across multiple systems.
* Leverage machine learning to automate detection, triage, and escalation processes.
* Monitor and fine-tune models to ensure accuracy, efficiency, and reliability.

***Collaboration and Stakeholder Engagement:***

* Partner with product teams, service delivery managers, and architects to align solutions with business goals.
* Act as a subject matter expert in data science, providing insights and recommendations to improve processes.
* Translate business requirements into actionable data science solutions.

***Continuous Improvement:***

* Analyze existing processes to identify inefficiencies and propose data-driven enhancements.
* Stay updated on industry trends, tools, and technologies to incorporate best practices into the team’s work.
* Contribute to building a library of reusable models and solutions to support the broader organization.

***Data Visualization and Reporting:***

* Develop dashboards and reports to visualize insights, track SLA adherence, and measure MTTR improvements.
* Communicate findings and progress to both technical and non-technical stakeholders effectively.

**Essential requirements:**  

* 5+ years of experience in data science, with a focus on machine learning and predictive analytics.
* Proven experience deploying machine learning models in production environments.
* Experience in incident management or operational optimization.
* Strong programming skills in Python, R, and SQL.

**•** Proficiency with machine learning frameworks like Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch. **•** Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, GCP, AWS) and MLOps tools.
  

Experience with ITSM platforms (e.g., ServiceNow) and monitoring tools (e.g., Splunk, Dynatrace).
  

* Hands-on experience in Predictive and Proactive Operations or similar domains.
* Knowledge of incident, event, or workflow management processes.
* Familiarity with SLA-driven operational environments.

  

**Please explain how you meet all the requirements** **when applying.**  

  

**Utilization****:** 100**%**  

**Location:** Stockholm  

**Period**: 06-01-2025-28-11-2025  

**Last day to apply**: 27-12-2024  

We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Test Engineer (HIL)
description:
**We are looking for test engineers to our client in the automotive**

Join our dynamic team to shape the future of advanced driver assistance systems, infotainment, and connected experiences in the automotive industry. You will play a key role in developing and maintaining automation frameworks, improving test methodologies, and supporting the continuous integration infrastructure to ensure the highest quality standards in embedded systems.

**What you'll do**

As a Test Automation Engineer, you will take a key role in ensuring the quality and reliability of advanced automotive systems. Your responsibilities will span across developing and maintaining robust automation frameworks used to verify cutting-edge technologies, such as radar, lidar, and cameras. You will design and implement tools for data visualization, enabling clear and effective presentation of test results and metrics. Efficient database management will be a core aspect of your role, ensuring seamless storage and retrieval of critical test data.

You will also monitor and analyze automated tests, reporting defects and collaborating closely with developers to resolve issues. Supporting Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) setups, you will fault-trace and enhance system reliability. Additionally, you will play a crucial role in improving rig operations and CI infrastructure, optimizing workflows to ensure stability and efficiency for development teams. In this role, you will collaborate across teams, sharing knowledge and providing training to stakeholders on test automation tools and processes.

**Who are you?**

* Strong Python programming skills, including experience with object-oriented design.
* Hands-on experience in HIL and SIL environments, and familiarity with simulation tools like dSPACE, CANoe, or CANalyzer.
* Proficiency in tools such as Grafana, PowerBI, Jenkins, or Zuul.
* Familiarity with Linux/QNX operating systems and shell scripting.
* Experience with test automation tools like Pytest, Robot Framework, or Selenium.
* Knowledge of continuous integration systems and cloud infrastructure (Azure or similar).
* Bachelor's degree in Engineering or equivalent experience.

**Ways to stand out from the crowd**

* Background in the automotive domain, particularly with advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS) or infotainment systems.
* Familiarity with UDS, XCP, HDF logging, and head-unit ECU development.
* Knowledge of Android Automotive OS and collaborations with partners like Google, Apple, and QNX.
* Experience with CI tools like Gerrit, Docker, Ansible, Terraform, and MongoDB.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proactive and self-driven mindset.

**Why join us**

Based in our vibrant Gothenburg office, this full-time role provides the chance to significantly influence the future of automotive technology. Our leadership extends beyond technical skills to fostering an environment where every team member can thrive. We support both professional and personal development, encouraging our team to explore new ideas and maintain a healthy work-life balance. As a member of our team, you'll spearhead not only technological innovation but also the creation of a culture that values diversity, learning, and collaboration. Join us in advancing automotive technology while cultivating a supportive and thriving team environment.

title: Named Account Sales Executive
description:
Job Requisition ID #
24WD84152
Position Overview
Exciting opportunity for a successful salesperson to be introduced to and progress into a new role as a Named Accounts Sales Executive. This direct sales role will be based in Sweden, working with around 4 customers in AEC including Manufacturing, Architecture, Engineering and Construction industries. Although you will work with different companies the Software you will sell is the same for each company focusing on our state-of-the-art Software Solutions. You will report to the Named Accounts Sales Director in the Nordics. We value hybrid working and if you live near enough to one of our offices you are welcome to work there some or all of the time but remote working is also supported.
As part of our company aim to increase diversity, we would appreciate applications from female candidates.
Responsibilities* You will develop, long-term and influential business relationships within assigned customers, communicating at all levels (internally and externally) including C-level
* You will achieve revenue and consumption growth-targets
* You will collaborate with customers and partners
* You will combine a role where you will explore new business opportunities with current customers in addition to building on and expanding established relationships
* You will be a trusted advisor, identifying and communicating business values that link our solutions to your customers business needs
* You will negotiate customer agreements
* You will develop and implement account plans and sales strategies
* You will forecast revenue and build expansion pipelines within the assigned accounts


Minimum Qualifications* You have several years enterprise software sales track record, carrying a quota and managing multiple accounts
* You have strong sales process and account planning skills (TAS, Value Based Selling etc.)
* You have experience of working with key accounts
* You are comfortable handling complex deal negotiation such as (Enterprise Business Agreements)
* You have written and verbal fluency in English
* You are willing and able to travel internationally and domestically


Preferred Qualifications* SaaS / cloud sales experience would be much appreciated.
* Fluency in either Swedish, Finnish, Danish or Norwegian would be beneficial but is not important to the role

title: ServiceNow Specialist
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.  

At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story.  

Cognizant is a global leader within Information Technology Services (Fortune 500 since 2011). The company was founded in 1994, and the Head Quarters is still in USA. Cognizant, which was originally Dun & Bradstreets own inhouse bureau, serves the market with vertical solutions for digital automation (cloud, AI, IoT and analytics). Cognizant operates in industries like Health Care, Life Science, Banking and Finance, Insurance, Retail, Production, Logistics, Energy etc and is a key player within the Digital revolution. Cognizant Global has a revenue of USD 17 billion and nearly 300 000 employees.


We are looking for a highly skilled ServiceNow Specialist with extensive knowledge in modules primarily HRSD, ITSM, and Service Portal to our office in Stockholm. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in analyzing, designing, developing/writing, and managing ServiceNow applications, with recent implementation experience in the HRSD module.

  

**The role**  

In this role, you will translate business requirements into technical specifications and create deliverables in different phases of the project life-cycle by decomposing functionality into specifications and business rules. You will produce business requirement documents (BRD), functional specifications, and business process flows. You will analyze business processes and perform gap analysis, impact analysis, and feasibility studies.  

You will liaise with onsite/offsite development teams on a daily basis to monitor project progress by tracking activity, resolving problems, publishing progress reports, and recommending actions. You will gather business requirements by interfacing with internal and external stakeholders and conduct analysis for application development. Additionally, you will facilitate requirement workshops.  

A detailed knowledge of Service Desk processes and ITIL standards is essential. You should have experience with ServiceNow implementation and knowledge in ServiceNow Orchestration. Good knowledge of ServiceNow Plugins, along with strong communication, presentation, and client handling skills, is required. Proficiency in Java Scripting and hands-on experience with ITIL process implementation is also necessary.  

You will be responsible for custom application design and development on the ServiceNow platform, with hands-on design, development, and deployment experience. You should be adept at creating required information for reporting and dashboards.

  

**Technical Expertise**

* Knowledge in HRSD Life Cycle, ITSM
* Customisation and Administration of ServiceNow Core Modules
* ServiceNow Client side and Server Side Scripting.
* Data importing using Import Sets (Data Source/Import Sets/Transform Maps)
* Service portal knowledge.
* Administration and creation of interactive portals.
* Strong in ITIL processes.
* ServiceNow Orchestration
* Provide software configuration and customization including, but not limited to: screen tailoring, workflow administration, report setup, data imports,  

integration, custom scripting and third party software integrations
* Obtain and analyze business requirements and document technical solutions
* Develop, design and rollout new application modules, workflows and catalog requests
* Research new functionality and recommend solutions that deliver customer value

**Preferred Skills**


* Understanding of Configuration Management as it relates to ITIL
* Web Services Integration (SOAP, REST, and JSON)
* Experience implementing systems using the Agile/Scrum methodology
* Experienced in the System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) processes including customer requirement analysis and system design
* Administration of a ServiceNow instance including the delegation of groups, modification of CMS, workflows, business rules, UI actions, UI policies, ACLs, dictionary, catalog items and updates of all other existing solutions requiring revisions
* ITIL certification is a plus
* RSD ServiceNow Implementer Certification is a plus

**Candidates should demonstrate experience in the following areas:**

* Design and delivery of technical solutions based on the ServiceNow platform
* Leadership skills in technical initiatives
* Generating detailed documentation
* Communications that clearly articulate solutions and the ability to perform demonstrations

**Language**  

Fluent in both English and Swedish, written as verbal.

title: Teknikinformatör
description:
Ansök nu


Kompetensutveckling och spännande uppdrag i all ära men på Etteplan är gemenskap och kollegial samhörighet lika viktigt! Här är det högt i tak och du får vara som du är. Olikheter är något vi omfamnar då vi vet att det berikar och bidrar till nya perspektiv. Vi har fokus på att bibehålla en familjär känsla på våra kontor och alla är viktiga för att bygga teamet tillsammans – vi kallar det för Smarter Toghether!



Din roll  

I rollen som teknisk skribent kommer du att arbeta nära våra kunder. Dessa finns inom flera olika branscher och många är också branschledande inom sina respektive områden. Vi arbetar i både nationella och internationella projekt där vi leder och fördelar arbetet, men även på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Placeringsorten kommer att vara Göteborg och teamet består av teknikinformatörer med olika kompetenser – skribenter, illustratörer, metodtekniker, projektledare och kombinationer av dessa. Vi arbetar ofta över kontorsgränserna och tillämpar hybridarbete, vilket kan ge möjlighet att arbeta viss tid från annan plats än kontoret.


Som teknikinformatör är din huvudsakliga arbetsuppgift att skapa och utveckla olika typer av teknisk dokumentation åt någon eller några av våra kunder. Du kommer att erbjudas möjlighet att arbeta både under eget ansvar i mindre projekt men även som en del i större projekt. Du kommer att ha kontakt med kund för informationsöverföring och ansvarar sedan för processen från start till klart – självständigt eller i en arbetsgrupp.



Vårt recept på framgång är teamwork, utveckling och en stor dos ”kul på jobbet”. Tillsammans jobbar vi också för att ge våra kunder de allra bästa lösningarna.



Din profil  

Vi söker dig som redan är och vill fortsätta utvecklas som teknikinformatör alternativt har en annan lämplig bakgrund och ett intresse för teknik och skrivande. Som konsult får du möjlighet till uppdrag hos olika kunder och därför är dina personliga egenskaper viktiga. Du är en social person som nyfiket tar dig an utmaningar samtidigt som du är lösningsorienterad och metodisk. Du gillar samarbete men är också självgående och tar ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter. Vidare är du kommunikativ och uttrycker dig obehindrat på både svenska och engelska för en effektiv dialog med kunder och medarbetare.



För att kunna möta våra kunders behov behöver du dessutom:


* Kunna skriva pedagogiskt, ha känsla för text och struktur
* Ha en passande eftergymnasial utbildning, som ger dig en bra grund som teknisk skribent
* Kunna förstå nya produkter och sätta dig in i användarens informationsbehov vid det givna tillfället



Det är meriterande om du är van vid att jobba i något XML-baserat CMS, kan skriva topic-baserat samt att du är bekväm att arbeta med verktygen inom Adobe Creative Cloud och Microsoft 365. Har du dessutom kunskap inom CAD, STE (Simplified Technical English), DITA och/eller S1000D är det ett extra plus!



Känner du att Etteplan är rätt för dig? Skicka in din ansökan idag och bli en del av vårt team!



Årsskiftet brukar vara en överlastad period när vi har många annonser publicerade över ledigheten och därmed även har många sökande, därför kan det ta längre tid för oss att återkoppla till dig om din status i din rekryteringsprocess. Vi tackar dig för din förståelse och ditt tålamod!

title: Senior Networking and Cybersecurity Engineer
description:
Company Overview
  
Cloudist is a cutting-edge cloud provider, delivering innovative infrastructure solutions to MSPs in the Nordics. We're expanding our team and looking for a Senior Networking and Cybersecurity Engineer who can take charge of our cloud network infrastructure, ensuring that it remains modern, scalable, secure, and highly available.
  
Position Overview
  
As a Senior Networking and Cybersecurity Engineer, your primary focus will be on designing, implementing, and maintaining robust networking and security solutions for our datacenter environments. You will be a key player in improving the performance, scalability, and security of our cloud services, working with cutting-edge technologies to meet both current and future demands.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

**Datacenter Networking Design & Implementation:** Architect, deploy, and maintain networking solutions in both the physical and logical layers, ensuring a secure and high-performing environment for our cloud services.
  
**Presales & Customer Engagement:** Collaborate with partners and customers to design cloud networking and security solutions tailored to their needs, offering expert guidance in presale engagements.
  
**Infrastructure Modernization & Automation:** Lead efforts to modernize and automate our network infrastructure, enhancing scalability, performance, and reliability within our datacenters.
  
**Security Solutions:** Implement and manage security measures across our cloud infrastructure, including firewalls, IDS/IPS, and DDoS protection, ensuring compliance with the highest standards of cybersecurity.
  
**Project Leadership:** Serve as the technical project lead for networking and security initiatives, driving projects from conception to implementation.
  
  

**Key Competencies:**  

**Enterprise Networking:** Deep knowledge of enterprise network design and architecture, with the ability to adapt traditional networks to cloud-based environments.
  
**Internet Networking:** Expertise in internet protocols (BGP, Load Balancing, VLANs, etc.), with hands-on experience in NSX-T, firewall, and routing technologies.
  
**Cybersecurity:** Proficiency in implementing cybersecurity solutions including firewalls (FW), intrusion detection and prevention systems (IDS/IPS), identity management (IdP), and DDoS mitigation.
  
**Cloud Infrastructure:** Strong understanding of virtualized environments and experience working with VMware and other cloud technologies.
  
**Automation:** Ability to collaborate with our software development team to integrate networking and security automation, ensuring seamless operations and a cloud experience to our customers.
  
  

**Experience & Qualifications:**  

10+ years of experience in senior-level networking roles, ideally in a datacenter or cloud provider environment.
  
Substantial hands-on experience with routing protocols (BGP), switching, network virtualization (VMware NSX-T), load balancing, and cybersecurity solutions.
  
**Familiarity with the following products and vendors is a plus:**
  
A10 ADC
  
Fortinet
  
Dell PowerSwitch series
  
VMware NSX-T
  
  

**Personality & Soft Skills:**  

A strong passion for continuous learning, with a willingness to evolve and take on new challenges.
  
High level of energy, self-motivation, and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively in our team (seven people currently).
  
A solution-oriented mindset with a drive to find innovative approaches to complex problems.
  
  

Why Join Us?
  
At Cloudist, we’re inspired by the beauty and responsibility symbolized by the Northern Lights. Just like this natural wonder, we aim to build cloud services that are sustainable, secure, and transparent.
  
**Innovative Environment:** Be part of a team that drives modernization, automation, and performance in cutting-edge cloud infrastructure.
  
**Professional Growth:** Tackle technical challenges and lead projects that shape the future of cloud networking and security.
  
**Collaborative Culture:** Work with a supportive team that values transparency in our delivery — no hidden costs, no lock-ins, just green, sustainable cloud solutions.

title: Housekeeping Supervisor
description:
Thon Partner Hotel Kungsbron är perfekt beläget i centrala Stockholm. Vi finns i det nya och miljövänliga Kungsbrohuset - ett stenkast ifrån centralstationen - och erbjuder ett prisvärt boende utan att kompromissa med bekvämlighet eller kvalitet. Vi har 151 rum och en konferensavdelning.
  
Vi söker nu en Housekeeping Supervisor med tillträde omgående. Tjänsten är på 100%. Som Housekeeping supervisor hos oss ansvarar du tillsammans med Housekeeping manager för den dagliga städningen av hotellet, du är första hand hotellstädare men utöver det får du extra ansvar och blir Housekeeping Managers högra hand det är därför av största vikt att du är självgående, ansvarstagande och pålitlig för att passa i vårt team.
  
Vi letar efter en person med ett positivt förhållningssätt, stort servicetänk gentemot både våra gäster din kollegor - och som kan hantera ett emellanåt högt tempo. Du ska ha ett öga för detaljer så att våra hotellrum alltid är i toppskick.
  
Vi lägger stor vikt vid att hitta medarbetare med rätt inställning och attityd och som tillsammans med oss vill skapa en härlig arbetsplats för sina medarbetare. Vi söker dig som inte är rädd för att emellanåt jobba hårt och ta egna initiativ, men som också samtidigt behöver vara lyhörd gentemot dina kollegor.
  
Du ska kunna tala och skriva svenska och engelska obehindrat. Erfarenhet av hotellstädning är ett krav. Tidigare erfarenhet av ledarskap är en stor merit. Du ska kunna ha bra kunskaper inom bokningssystem, gärna Opera Cloud.
  
Känner du att det är dig vi söker - skicka in din ansökan via email till jobb@kungsbronhotell.se och berätta varför! Vi kommer påbörja urvalsprocessen på en gång.

title: Tech lead for the Revenue Engineering team
description:
### **About us**


Soundtrack is a B2B company providing music streaming services to more than 80,000 businesses in over 70 countries, from the restaurant or retailer around the corner to larger brands such as Lululemon, Joe & The Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer.

  

The company consists of 90+ talented, motivated and humble employees. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion. Our headquarters are located in central Stockholm (Odenplan).

### **The role**


We are hiring a Technical lead for the Revenue Engineering team at Soundtrack. The team is responsible for subscription management, product packaging and business support systems.


In the capacity of Tech Lead and Senior Developer for our Revenue Engineering team, your core responsibility will be to lead and shape the architectural design and implementation of flexible and stable revenue solutions.

### **About you**


You're driven and entrepreneurial, but you know how to be a team player too. Regardless of roles, we're always looking to work with people who can adapt to constant change, prioritise what's important, stay humble, open, curious and get things done.

### **Key responsibilities**

* Technical leadership, guide the team in architectural decisions to develop a well-functioning and maintainable platform
* Define, implement and continuously improve the developmentprocesses and ways of working. Identify bottlenecks, pain points and work to remove them
* Responsible for resourceplanning which contributes to success metrics and our goals
* Ensure our backlog and a corresponding development plan balances features, improvements and bugs appropriately
* Align and synchronise development projects with the respective roadmaps of other teams
* Mentor and provide guidance within the team, fostering a culture of continuous learning, improvement and technical excellence
* Champion and promote best practices for development teams and technology

### 

### **Requirements**


You have an excellent understanding of system architecture and best practices in SaaS environments or billing-related systems and you have proficiency in at least one major programming language (e.g. GO, Scala, Java, Python).



Furthermore, you are experienced within most or all of the following areas:

* Cloud native architecture (GCP, AWS or Azure)
* Working on large scale, complex distributed systems and code bases
* Services APIs
* GraphQL APIs and libraries (we use Caliban on the backend and Apollo for clients)
* Automated testing
* 

### **About you**


We're always looking to work with people who are friendly and professional. You’ll likely describe yourself as:

  

* Highly organised
* Open-minded and keen to learn
* Appreciative of a fast paced and dynamic work environment
* You communicate complex ideas in a simple way

### **Employee benefits**

* You have the freedom to decide where you work the best with our Work From Anywhere program with a one-off setup bonus included
* Generous pension plan
* Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
* Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription
* Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites

  

If you have any questions about the position or need to reach out, get in touch with Marcus Revfalk at Marcus@soundtrackyourbrand.com.


Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by email.

title: Security and Compliance Lead
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


We are seeking a highly skilled Security and Compliance Lead to join our team. As the Security and Compliance Lead for product areas integrating built-in security principles, your role is to ensure the security and compliance of products throughout their entire development lifecycle. This role comes under Product Area Customer Experience - Enterprise IT unit. You will lead the integration of security practices, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and foster a security-aware culture.

**What you will do:**

* Integration of Security Practices: Lead the integration of security practices into the Product Area (PA) workflow, ensuring security is embedded at every stage of the development process. Collaborate with development, operations, and security teams to implement security controls, automate security testing, and establish security checkpoints within the CI/CD pipeline.
* Built-in Security Features: Work closely with product development teams to design and implement built-in security features and controls. Conduct threat modeling exercises and integrate security controls directly into the product architecture and design.
* Security Automation and Orchestration: Utilize automation and orchestration tools to streamline security processes and workflows. Automate security scans, vulnerability assessments, and compliance checks, while orchestrating security tasks and responses to security incidents.
* Security Training and Awareness: Collaborate with the IT Security & Compliance team to provide tailored security training and awareness programs. Educate developers, operators, and other stakeholders about secure coding practices, cloud security fundamentals, and DevSecOps principles.
* Security Governance and Compliance Reporting: Adhere to governance frameworks for IT security practices and develop compliance reporting mechanisms to ensure alignment with industry standards and regulatory requirements.

**The skills you bring:**

* 10+ Years working experience in Security and Compliance.
* Analytical skills with proficiency in understanding information flows and strong analytical abilities.
* In-depth knowledge of security standards such as ISO 27000, NIST SP 800-53,
* NIST 800-171, GDPR, NIS 2, SSDF.
* Leadership experience leading global teams with high integrity and collaboration skills.
* Deep understanding of the operational interface between business and IT.
* Ability to prioritize and collaborate with various stakeholders to align IT-Security Solution delivery with organizational strategy.
* CISA, CISM, CISSP, ISO Lead Auditor, SAP Certification.
* Experience in a similar role within a large, complex organization.
* Security clearance is required.

**Job Location:** Sweden & India

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** India (IN) || Gurgaon

title: E2E Feature Verification Engineer
description:
**Grow with us**
----------------

  

  

About this opportunity

  

  

5G and Cloud RAN is already a reality, and Ericsson is the leader in bringing it to the market. There has never been a better time for you to make your mark. A large group of skilled developers are working energetically to convert 5G and Cloud RAN plans into reality. We are growing and looking for more talent!

  

PEU RAN Performance PEG3 is part of Integrated RAN in Business Area Networks and responsible for driving Baseband software product development end-to-end by having competence and capability to take on full feature responsibility.

  

As a Feature Verification Engineer and Integrator, you will work in a team that has the responsibility for developing 5G Baseband and Cloud RAN software products. That means testing and integrating advanced signal-processing functions and algorithms in a cycle and memory constrained real-time environment. The test environment is both simulated and true end-to-end including Core Network, Radio Access nodes and real or simulated mobile phones.

  

You will experience a truly collaborative and supportive environment, both in terms of tools and colleagues. And you will have lots of fun!

  

PEU RAN Performance is located mainly on different sites in Sweden, Canada, China and US. This position is placed at the Stockholm Kista site.

  

In short you will:  

* Develop (integrate and test) 5G and Cloud RAN baseband architecture, functionality, and features in an end-to-end as well as in a partly simulated environment
* Write inventive, high quality, clean, optimized test code for use in verification and continuous integration
* Maintain and improve the quality of L1 and L2 part of the Baseband product by securing legacy coverage in test loops
* Perform trouble shooting and customer support
* Drive continuous improvements of products, environments, and processes
* Make sure that the right test environment is available in time, both the actual system test plant and the test environment with tools and automation frameworks
* Analyze new requirements from new features
**Join our Team**
-----------------

  

You will bring

  

Your personal qualities are important for us, and we believe that you are productive, creative and that you interact easily with other people. In addition, you can plan and drive your own work to reach common goals together with your team. You are also able to adapt and respond quickly to change. Furthermore, you are positively set and strive to meet and exceed our customers’ expectations.

  

In addition, we believe you have:  

* Solid experience and interest in software test and integration
* Mobile communication competence
* MSc in a technical field or equivalent level of knowledge
* Programming/scripting skills (Java, Python)
* Multi-core processor understanding
* Real-time embedded systems knowledge
  

Why join Ericsson?

  

At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and creativity to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next. Ericsson is dedicated to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment, where everyone can thrive and bring their unique perspectives.  

  

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: BDR Internship - Launch Your Sales & Business Development Career
description:
- Devoteam G Cloud is an award-winning Google Cloud partner renowned for its innovative and collaborative culture. With a team of over 600 Google Cloud experts, we deliver cutting-edge solutions to businesses across the globe. Our Stockholm office is a dynamic hub for technological advancement, and we're looking for driven individuals to join our growing team.

  
Are you eager to kickstart your career in sales and business development? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy connecting with people? This BDR internship offers an unparalleled opportunity to gain hands-on experience at the forefront of the technology industry.


**As a BDR Intern, you will:**

* **Drive business growth:** Play a key role in identifying and qualifying potential clients, generating leads, and contributing to the company's sales pipeline.
* **Develop key sales skills:** Master the art of outreach, including crafting compelling cold emails and conducting engaging cold calls to connect with prospects.
* **Become a trusted advisor:** Build relationships with potential clients, understand their business challenges, and position Devoteam G Cloud's solutions effectively.
* **Collaborate with sales professionals:** Work closely with our experienced sales team to develop and execute targeted outreach strategies.
* **Contribute to sales strategy:** Participate in sales meetings, contribute to account planning sessions, and gain insights into the sales process from lead generation to close.
* **Gain market intelligence:** Research target industries and identify key decision-makers to expand Devoteam G Cloud's reach.

  
* Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in business, marketing, or a related field.
* Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills.
* A strong desire to learn and a passion for sales and business development.
* Self-motivated and results-oriented with a proactive approach.
* Interest in technology and cloud computing is a plus.

  
- **What You Gain:**


	* **Comprehensive sales experience:** Gain valuable experience across all stages of the sales cycle, from lead generation to relationship building and closing deals.
	* **Mentorship from sales leaders:** Learn from experienced sales professionals and receive guidance to develop your skills and advance your career.
	* **Networking opportunities:** Build connections with industry leaders and expand your professional network within the technology sector.
	* **Cutting-edge knowledge:** Gain insight into the world of cloud computing and the latest Google Cloud technologies.
	* **Launchpad for your career:** This internship provides a strong foundation for a successful career in sales and business development within a dynamic and growing company.**Additional Information:**

This is an unpaid internship opportunity based in our Stockholm office.


**Apply Now!**

Submit your CV along with a motivational letter explaining why you're the perfect fit for Devoteam G Cloud and your aspirations for a career in sales and business development.

title: Privacy Legal
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------

 **About this opportunity:**


Ericsson and some of the world’s largest telecom operators have announced a new venture to combine and sell network Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) on a global scale to spur innovation in digital services. The venture will drive implementation and access to common APIs from multiple telecom service providers to a broader ecosystem of developer platforms. We are seeking a General Counsel for the new venture, which will be 50% owned by Ericsson and 50% owned by telecom operators.


The newly formed company will provide network APIs to a broad ecosystem of developer platforms, including hyperscalers (HCPs), Communications Platform as a Service (CPaaS) providers, System Integrators (SIs) and Independent Software Vendors (ISVs), based on existing industry-wide CAMARA APIs (the open-source project driven by the GSMA and the Linux Foundation). Vonage and Google Cloud will partner with the new company, providing access to their ecosystems of millions of developers as well as their partners.

 **What you will do:**

* Rollout of privacy policies across NewCo and related entities
* Building NewCo privacy requirements and controls, support their implementation.
* Ongoing monitoring of privacy requirements and controls
* Building privacy by design into products and services through proactive privacy impact assessments and corporate function privacy assessments (e.g., Sales, Marketing, HR, Finance).
* Support commercial teams by providing privacy advice and negotiating relevant data protection agreements with resellers, suppliers, vendors and customers.
* Monitoring, communicating and adjusting to developments in global privacy legal frameworks as well as in relevant industry best practices and standards.
* Identifying strategic opportunities and communicating them to relevant business teams.
* Promoting and maintaining privacy awareness across NewCo and delivering effective, role-based privacy training programs.
* Identify and manage, directly or through external advisors, contracting, risk analysis, regulatory compliance, and governance in countries throughout the world
* Managing consultants and outside counsel.

 **The skills you bring:**


Required

* 10+ years of experience working in privacy with in-house experience in a privacy department a requirement
* Expert legal or regulatory skills in privacy and data protection in the US, the UK and the EU
* Demonstrated ability to identify and solve problems in a complex technology and business environment by creating simple, repeatable and actionable solutions and policy positions.
* High degree of familiarity with risk analysis frameworks, communications regulatory compliance, and governance.

  

Desirable

* Excellent communication, presentation, public speaking and people skills
* Comfortable with ambiguity. Persistence to drive change over time
* Results oriented, proactive, responsible, pragmatic and ethical person with a strong interest in technologies and their societal impact.
* Experience with communication APIs a plus.
 **Application**  

We look forward to your application with CV in English. (The selection will be in January 2025)  

Last day to apply: 3rd of January 2025  

Location: Stockholm, Sweden or Ludz, Poland  

Flexibility of work: We target 60% attendance at office.

  

Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail.

  

If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Nina Juthage, Sr. Recruiter, at nina.a.juthage@ericsson.com

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**  

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

  

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.

  



If you need assistance or to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact Ericsson at hr.direct.mana@ericsson.com

  

DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees in this position. They are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for this position, and you may be required to perform additional job tasks as assigned.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: Cyber Security Consultant
description:
**About Us:** 




 Integrico has been empowering organizations to navigate the digital landscape since 2002. As a specialized consultancy firm, we are committed to excellence, personalized solutions, and fostering long-term partnerships with our clients. At Integrico, we combine our expertise with a human-centric approach, ensuring our work not only meets but exceeds expectations.
 



  





**Why Work With Us?** 




 Joining Integrico means you’ll be part of an experienced and passionate team dedicated to making an impact. We offer:
 


* **Exciting Projects:** 
 Be part of transformative initiatives with leading clients in finance, telecommunication, technology, and government.
* **Career Growth:** 
 Advance your skills through training, certifications, and tailored development programs designed to help you excel.
* **Flexibility:** 
 Enjoy hybrid work options to suit your lifestyle.
* **Perks:** 
 Competitive salary, benefits, and team building events.
* **Inclusive Culture:** 
 A supportive environment where your ideas matter and innovation thrives.



  





**Your Role:** 




 As a Cybersecurity Consultant at Integrico, you’ll:
 


* Deliver cutting-edge cybersecurity solutions tailored to client needs.
* Perform risk assessments and drive compliance with ISO 27001, GDPR, SCF, and DORA frameworks.
* Provide advisory services on regulatory standards, audits, and governance practices.
* Collaborate on complex projects, helping clients tackle today’s most pressing cybersecurity challenges.
* Translate technical concepts into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
* Act as a trusted advisor to clients, building strong relationships and delivering value.
* Identify and pursue opportunities to expand business within client accounts.



  





**What We’re Looking For:** 




 We value passion and expertise. You should bring:
 


* 3+ years of experience in cybersecurity or information security roles.
* Knowledge of compliance frameworks such as ISO 27001, PCI-DSS, NIS2, GDPR, and DORA.
* Hands-on experience with risk assessments, governance frameworks, or security operations.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills for client engagement.
* A large professional network and the ability to cultivate client relationships.
* A proactive mindset and the ability to work autonomously or as part of a team.
* A self-driven attitude, with the capability to identify and drive business opportunities.



  





 While certifications like CISSP, CISM, or CISA are a plus, we prioritize real-world experience and a drive to excel.
 



  





**Join Us:** 




 If you’re ready to contribute to a dynamic, growing organization where your work makes a difference, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build the future of cybersecurity together!🌟
 



  





 Apply now and become part of the Integrico family.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?** 




  





 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
 


* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.



  





**We at the Infrastructure team,** 
 work on a vision to empower our product-oriented teams with a complete self-service analytics platform to make data-driven decisions possible in Truecaller, guaranteeing the stability, velocity, and delivery of the mainstream events pipeline.
 



  





**As a Data Engineer** 
 , you will play an important role in the Data Platform team which is responsible for building and maintaining a scalable, robust, self-service analytics platform.
 



  





**What do we expect from you:** 



* 3+ years of experience in data engineering
* Experience working with orchestration tool (ex: Airflow)
* Experience working with a large data set
* Experience building complex ETL pipelines
* Experience working with cloud providers such as GCP, AWS, or Azure
* Strong programming skills in Spark with Scala and Python
* Experience working with CI/CD tools like Jenkins and Git
* Strong understanding of Software Engineering practices and principles
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
* Self-motivated and have a proven ability to take initiative to own the problems that come up and solve them



  





**What will you work on:** 



* Maintaining and improving the ingestion pipeline to reliably deliver billions of events daily in defined SLA
* Provide support for all teams in building and optimizing their complex pipelines
* Work closely with other teams to identify pain points and problems around the platform
* Develop new tools and frameworks to improve the data platform
* Facilitate company-wide to be data-driven
* Work in close collaboration with data scientists and data analysts to help support their work in production
* Work with vast projects such as building an ML platform and streaming use cases
* Setup best practices and processes around software and data development



  





**It would be great if you also have:** 



* Working with messaging systems like Kafka
* Knowledge in Kubernetes
* Hands-on experience with any streaming platform
* Experience managing data warehouse in BigQuery or Redshift



  





 Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/
 



  





 Sounds like your dream job?
 



  





 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
 



 This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
 



 We only accept applications in English.
 



  





**What we offer:** 




  




* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package:** 
 Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** 
 We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There is something for everyone!



  





**Come as you are:** 




 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

title: Senior Hybrid Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Company Description**
 We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.
   

  

 Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Global Cloud Infrastructure Team is seeking a skilled Hybrid Cloud Operations Engineer to join our international team. As part of this dynamic team, you will play a key role in supporting our commercial offerings. Unit4 operates a sophisticated infrastructure spanning Microsoft Azure and on-premises data centers in Sweden. In this role, you will primarily work with Windows Server Virtual Machines deployed on VMware while also assisting in the setup of virtual networks and Azure native solutions.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Required:**
* 5+ years of relevant experience
* Deep knowledge of Windows Server architecture and Active Directory
* Familiarity with Microsoft Azure
* Minimum 4 years experience with VMware and virtualization technologies
* Experience automating Windows systems using PowerShell or similar methods
* Hands-on experience with physical data centers, including cabling, moving components, etc.
* Flexibility to work outside of office hours and participate in weekend on-call support.
* Strong prioritization skills, both independently and as part of a team
* Proficient troubleshooting skills, with the ability to resolve complex issues
* Passion for learning new technologies and exploring innovative ideas
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for engaging with internal and external customers


**Nice to Have:**
* Familiarity with Microsoft Azure & Microsoft certifications
* Experience with Dell Servers, Cisco Network devices
* Knowledge of networking (VPN setup), file transfer servers, Microsoft SQL, and PKI infrastructure
* Experience with AWS


**Additional Information**
 A chance to participate in the development of a leading global software firm. You have the opportunity to work within an organization, that gives you the freedom and autonomy to be successful. An attractive salary while working in a challenging international environment with enthusiastic colleagues who like to learn from each other.
   

  

 At Unit4 we invest in your personal and professional growth. We don't focus on how many days you work, we trust you on delivering results - thus, we have an unlimited vacation policy.
   

  

**This role may require security clearance required for customer projects and access to sensitive (customer) data. That means that after you have accepted our offer, we could ask for background checks. Subject to applicable local laws, such security checks may require disclosure of personal information including criminal record declaration, right to work, personal identification and work history. No worries though – we'll handle it according to local privacy laws and keep your info safe. Questions? Feel free to reach out!**

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Role:**
 The Senior Data Scientist will play a critical role in driving the development of AI and machine learning models to enhance Predictive and Proactive Operations. The role requires a blend of technical expertise, analytical thinking, and collaborative skills to create innovative data-driven solutions that optimize incident management workflows, improve SLA adherence, and reduce MTTR. The Senior Data Scientist will work closely with cross-functional teams and contribute to building a robust and efficient operational framework.
   

  

****Key Responsibilities:****
*****Data Science and Model Development:*****
* Design and implement predictive and prescriptive models to address operational challenges.
* Develop algorithms to optimize multi-system incident workflows and improve SLA compliance.
* Collaborate with data engineers to build scalable data pipelines and ensure efficient data processing.


***Incident Management Solutions:***
* Apply advanced analytics to enhance end-to-end incident workflows across multiple systems.
* Leverage machine learning to automate detection, triage, and escalation processes.
* Monitor and fine-tune models to ensure accuracy, efficiency, and reliability.


***Collaboration and Stakeholder Engagement:***
* Partner with product teams, service delivery managers, and architects to align solutions with business goals.
* Act as a subject matter expert in data science, providing insights and recommendations to improve processes.
* Translate business requirements into actionable data science solutions.


***Continuous Improvement:***
* Analyze existing processes to identify inefficiencies and propose data-driven enhancements.
* Stay updated on industry trends, tools, and technologies to incorporate best practices into the team’s work.
* Contribute to building a library of reusable models and solutions to support the broader organization.


***Data Visualization and Reporting:***
* Develop dashboards and reports to visualize insights, track SLA adherence, and measure MTTR improvements.
* Communicate findings and progress to both technical and non-technical stakeholders effectively.


****Essential requirements:****
 5+ years of experience in data science, with a focus on machine learning and predictive analytics. Proven experience deploying machine learning models in production environments. Experience in incident management or operational optimization. Strong programming skills in Python, R, and SQL. Proficiency with machine learning frameworks like Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch. Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, GCP, AWS) and MLOps tools. Experience with ITSM platforms (e.g., ServiceNow) and monitoring tools (e.g., Splunk, Dynatrace). Hands-on experience in Predictive and Proactive Operations or similar domains. Knowledge of incident, event, or workflow management processes.
 - Familiarity with SLA-driven operational environments.

title: Level 2 Threathunter (Crowdstrike Identity Cloud)
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a
 **Crowdstrike** 
**focused** 
**Threat Analyst L2** 
 to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists in our Managed Security Services business unit.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 300 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Level 2 Threathunter who wants to make a difference in our Managed Security Services.
   

  

**Managed Security Services**
 Truesec helps customers globally with Attack Prediction Services, Vulnerability Management Services and Managed Detection & Response services for IT and OT environments. Our services are all delivered by skilled security analysis teams that conducts 24/7 attack monitoring, threat hunting, threat intelligence analysis, and threat remediation. Our team of experts works tirelessly to identify and prevent cyber breaches, and to help increase our customers’ proactive cybersecurity defenses. Our goal is to be an extension of our customers’ IT organizations, customizing a combination of capabilities and tooling, tailored to prevent cyber attacks in the most efficient way.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Threat Analyst L2 in the Threat Analyst and Detection Engineering team at Truesec you will work with a wide range of assignments, including analysis and investigation of the most advanced and complex attacks, detection engineering activities, and service enhancements in specific focus areas. As a Threat Analyst L2 at Truesec you are expected to have one or more focus areas where you excel in expertise utilized for both internal and external engagements. For this particular position we are looking for someone with extensive Crowdstrike experience.
   

  

 Within this role you are expected to act as a Subject Matter Expert guiding both customers and colleagues in Crowdstrike related projects such as onboarding of devices, configuration of the Crowstrike platform and sensor, as well as day-to-day work in terms of advanced analysis and threat hunting within the tool. A genuine interest in cyber security in general and Crowdstrike in particular combined with a strong technical background is crucial to fulfill the expectations within the role.  Equally important is being actively engaged in developing new skillsets and knowledge development for the entire team by having a continuous learning mindset.
   

  

**Your Potential Background**
 You have the passion and drive to keep our customers safe, so they can sleep soundly at night knowing we are protecting them.
   

  

 We believe you have extensive experience in advanced security technologies and that you are skilled in areas such as EDR, NDR, SIEM and Cloud. You always think one step ahead regarding how the attacker might be trying to gain access, and what they may be after!
   

  

**Required Skills:**
* Minimum 2 years working experience within security operations or similar
* Confident in verbal and written communication with internal and external stakeholders
* A good understanding of the Crowdstrike portfolio. E.g. sensor deployment, platform configuration, alert analysis and tuning
* Determined in pushing the product development and the way we utilize and work with the product
* Basic knowledge of operating systems internals
* Understanding of basic threat hunting methodologies
* Experience in incident report writing


 Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.
   

  

**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Data Engineer
description:
Din roll
   

  

 Som Data Engineer hos oss kommer du att arbeta som konsult och få möjlighet att samarbeta med olika kunder i varierande branscher. Du kommer att arbeta med att samla in, hantera och analysera stora mängder data för att stödja affärsbeslut och skapa innovativa lösningar. I rollen ingår att designa och implementera dataflöden som är skalbara och effektiva, samt bidra med insikter och förbättringar för att optimera våra processer.
   

  

 Du kommer att få erfarenhet av olika miljöer och utmaningar, vilket ger dig en unik möjlighet att bredda din kompetens och förståelse för hur data kan användas för att driva verksamheter framåt. I nära samarbete med andra team kommer du att vara med och utveckla lösningar som möjliggör smart och datadriven verksamhet.
   

  

 Det här är en roll där du får möjlighet att arbeta med hela datalivscykeln och bidra till att skapa insikter som driver beslut och innovation.
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Datainsamling samt att bygga och underhålla data pipelines och flöden, ELT/ETL, och Airflow.
* Större datalagringslösningar såsom data warehouses, data lakes och delta lakes.
* Datahantering inklusive datamodellering och rensning.
* Datavisualisering och analys med verktyg som Power BI, QlikSense och Grafana.
* Utveckling av REST API:er.


 Du har dessutom kunskap och intresse av:
   

  

* Kringliggande discipliner som data science, maskininlärning, analys och statistik.
* Azure och Databricks.
* Python och gärna PySpark.


 Varför Knowit?
   

  

 På Knowit Connectivity får du möjlighet att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö där vi kombinerar teknik och kreativitet för att skapa värde för våra kunder. Du blir en del av ett kompetent team där samarbete och kunskapsdelning är i fokus. Hos oss får du möjlighet att utvecklas, lära dig nya teknologier och arbeta i spännande projekt.
   

  

 Låter detta som en roll för dig?
   

  

 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och diskutera hur du kan bli en del av vårt team.

title: Sweco IT is looking for a Senior Specialist within Client Infrastructure
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Architecture and Planning, and Environmental Services
description:
**Why work with us?**
 Do you want variety in your everyday life and good conditions to grow in your role? Are you interested in operating in larger IT environments, managing thousands of devices, and deploying new features? We will strengthen our Infrastructure team at Sweco IT and are looking for someone who wants to be involved in developing future solutions within Intune and SCCM.
   

  

 You will be part of a global team and work with colleagues with specialist expertise in their field. We are a passionate team with a great deal of drive and curiosity who are happy to share our experience and knowledge in our areas of responsibility. Learning from each other and having fun at work is important to us and we act in line with our core behaviours; approachable, committed and with recognised expertise to match.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this exciting position, you will manage our existing environment and infrastructure, ensuring our services consistently meet business expectations without compromising security. You'll also engage in various projects, including migration initiatives. You will work closely with various teams within the IT department to ensure that our initiatives are effectively implemented. An important part of the role is external monitoring. This means actively and systematically following developments in technology and industry standards that affect the client's infrastructure and the user's work environment.
   

  

 We are embarking on an exciting transition from SCCM to Intune. In this role, you will have the opportunity to influence and shape our strategy to successfully achieve this objective.
   

  

 You’ll be part of the Infrastructure & Cloud unit at Sweco IT and report to the Group Manager for AD & Endpoint services. Business travel occurs as the team is currently located in four different countries. This position is based in Stockholm.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities And Tasks**
* Manage PC clients through Intune and SCCM.
* Host your existing SCCM environment.
* Manage mobile devices through Intune.
* Hardware Certification.
* Participate in migration projects.
* Create reports.
* Incident Management.


**Qualifications & Experience**
* Good knowledge in Intune
* Extensive experience and very good knowledge of operating larger Intune and SCCM environments.
* Skilled in PowerShell.
* Good knowledge within the Windows family.
* Proficiency in SQL Server Reporting Services or PowerBI.
* You feel comfortable communicating both verbally and in writing in English as this is our corporate language.


 Previous experience with Azure and related services is an advantage.
   

  

**Personal characteristics**
* Strong communication skills both verbal and in written form and ability to adjust communication depending on audience.
* You have a collaborative working style and ability to build strong relationships with various stakeholders.
* You have a curious mindset and an open-minded and enthusiastic approach.


 The landscape is constantly evolving from a technical, business and market perspective so we expect you to be a fast learner and a diligent searcher for knowledge in all these areas. You should be adaptable and willing to innovate as required. Finally, we expect you to independently shape your priorities and drive towards them.
   

  

**Why join Sweco?**
* Professional development opportunities and various training opportunities.
* A pleasant and dynamic working atmosphere in a growing and leading company.
* An industry that is going through a major shift in way of working
* A culture that values inclusion, innovation, and continuous learning
* Flexible work with freedom and responsibility and a competitive compensation package.


**Application**
 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process, don’t hesitate to contact us. We will get back to all applicants after the recruitment process has been completed. At Sweco, we strive to be a workplace characterized by diversity. We believe that more perspectives broaden our ability to continue to achieve our goals and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
   

  

 Do you want to be part of shaping the future? Then we look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**Contact Us**
 If you want to know more about the position or Sweco as a workplace, please contact Mirsad Mrzljak, Team Manager AD & Endpoint services, at Mirsad.mrzljak@sweco.se.
   

  

 Background checks will be carried out on the final candidate as part of this recruitment process. We use background checks from SRI.
   

  

*Sweco plans and designs the sustainable communities and cities of the future. Together with our customers, our 22,000 architects, engineers and other experts develop solutions to manage urbanization, take advantage of the opportunities of digitalization and make the societies of the future more sustainable. Sweco is the leading consulting company in technology and architecture in Europe with a turnover of approximately SEK 29 billion. The company is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For further information* 
 , http //www.sweco.se
